instanceMethods.name: setProxy
instanceMethods.description:
Resolves when the proxy setting process is complete.

Sets the proxy settings.

When `mode` is unspecified, `pacScript` and `proxyRules` are provided together, the `proxyRules` option is ignored and `pacScript` configuration is applied.

You may need `ses.closeAllConnections` to close currently in flight connections to prevent pooled sockets using previous proxy from being reused by future requests.

The `proxyRules` has to follow the rules below:

For example:

* `http=foopy:80;ftp=foopy2` - Use HTTP proxy `foopy:80` for `http://` URLs, and HTTP proxy `foopy2:80` for `ftp://` URLs.
* `foopy:80` - Use HTTP proxy `foopy:80` for all URLs.
* `foopy:80,bar,direct://` - Use HTTP proxy `foopy:80` for all URLs, failing over to `bar` if `foopy:80` is unavailable, and after that using no proxy.
* `socks4://foopy` - Use SOCKS v4 proxy `foopy:1080` for all URLs.
* `http=foopy,socks5://bar.com` - Use HTTP proxy `foopy` for http URLs, and fail over to the SOCKS5 proxy `bar.com` if `foopy` is unavailable.
* `http=foopy,direct://` - Use HTTP proxy `foopy` for http URLs, and use no proxy if `foopy` is unavailable.
* `http=foopy;socks=foopy2` - Use HTTP proxy `foopy` for http URLs, and use `socks4://foopy2` for all other URLs.

The `proxyBypassRules` is a comma separated list of rules described below:

* `[ URL_SCHEME "://" ] HOSTNAME_PATTERN [ ":" <port> ]`

Match all hostnames that match the pattern HOSTNAME_PATTERN.

Examples: "foobar.com", "*foobar.com", "*.foobar.com", "*foobar.com:99", "https://x.*.y.com:99"
* `"." HOSTNAME_SUFFIX_PATTERN [ ":" PORT ]`

Match a particular domain suffix.

Examples: ".google.com", ".com", "http://.google.com"
* `[ SCHEME "://" ] IP_LITERAL [ ":" PORT ]`

Match URLs which are IP address literals.

Examples: "127.0.1", "[0:0::1]", "[::1]", "http://[::1]:99"
* `IP_LITERAL "/" PREFIX_LENGTH_IN_BITS`

Match any URL that is to an IP literal that falls between the given range. IP range is specified using CIDR notation.

Examples: "192.168.1.1/16", "fefe:13::abc/33".
* `<local>`

Match local addresses. The meaning of `<local>` is whether the host matches one of: "127.0.0.1", "::1", "localhost".

properties.name: mode
properties.description: The proxy mode. Should be one of `direct`, `auto_detect`, `pac_script`, `fixed_servers` or `system`. If it's unspecified, it will be automatically determined based on other specified options.

Sets the certificate verify proc for `session`, the `proc` will be called with `proc(request, callback)` whenever a server certificate verification is requested. Calling `callback(0)` accepts the certificate, calling `callback(-2)` rejects it.

Calling `setCertificateVerifyProc(null)` will revert back to default certificate verify proc.

> **NOTE:** The result of this procedure is cached by the network service.

instanceMethods.name: setPermissionRequestHandler

Calling `callback(true)` will allow the permission and `callback(false)` will reject it. To clear the handler, call `setPermissionRequestHandler(null)`.  Please note that you must also implement `setPermissionCheckHandler` to get complete permission handling. Most web APIs do a permission check and then make a permission request if the check is denied.

Request for the app to enter fullscreen mode.
Request to open links in external applications.

instanceMethods.name: setPermissionCheckHandler
instanceMethods.description: Sets the handler which can be used to respond to permission checks for the `session`. Returning `true` will allow the permission and `false` will reject it.  Please note that you must also implement `setPermissionRequestHandler` to get complete permission handling. Most web APIs do a permission check and then make a permission request if the check is denied. To clear the handler, call `setPermissionCheckHandler(null)`.

parameters.name: webContents
parameters.description: WebContents checking the permission.  Please note that if the request comes from a subframe you should use `requestingUrl` to check the request origin.  Cross origin sub frames making permission checks will pass a `null` webContents to this handler.  You should use `embeddingOrigin` and `requestingOrigin` to determine what origin the owning frame and the requesting frame are on respectively.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: Type of permission check.  Valid values are `midiSysex`, `notifications`, `geolocation`, `media`,`mediaKeySystem`,`midi`, `pointerLock`, `fullscreen`, `openExternal`, or `serial`.

parameters.name: requestingOrigin
parameters.description: The origin URL of the permission check

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Some properties are only available on certain permission types.

properties.name: embeddingOrigin
properties.description: The origin of the frame embedding the frame that made the permission check.  Only set for cross-origin sub frames making permission checks.

properties.name: securityOrigin
properties.description: The security origin of the `media` check.

properties.name: mediaType
properties.description: The type of media access being requested, can be `video`, `audio` or `unknown`

properties.name: requestingUrl
properties.description: The last URL the requesting frame loaded.  This is not provided for cross-origin sub frames making permission checks.

properties.name: isMainFrame
properties.description: Whether the frame making the request is the main frame

instanceMethods.name: clearHostResolverCache
instanceMethods.description:
Resolves when the operation is complete.

Clears the host resolver cache.

instanceMethods.name: allowNTLMCredentialsForDomains
instanceMethods.description: Dynamically sets whether to always send credentials for HTTP NTLM or Negotiate authentication.

parameters.name: domains
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of servers for which integrated authentication is enabled.

instanceMethods.name: setUserAgent
instanceMethods.description:
Overrides the `userAgent` and `acceptLanguages` for this session.

The `acceptLanguages` must a comma separated ordered list of language codes, for example `"en-US,fr,de,ko,zh-CN,ja"`.

This doesn't affect existing `WebContents`, and each `WebContents` can use `webContents.setUserAgent` to override the session-wide user agent.

instanceMethods.name: isPersistent
instanceMethods.description: Whether or not this session is a persistent one. The default `webContents` session of a `BrowserWindow` is persistent. When creating a session from a partition, session prefixed with `persist:` will be persistent, while others will be temporary.

instanceMethods.name: getUserAgent
instanceMethods.description: The user agent for this session.

instanceMethods.name: setSSLConfig
instanceMethods.description: Sets the SSL configuration for the session. All subsequent network requests will use the new configuration. Existing network connections (such as WebSocket connections) will not be terminated, but old sockets in the pool will not be reused for new connections.

properties.name: minVersion
properties.description: Can be `tls1`, `tls1.1`, `tls1.2` or `tls1.3`. The minimum SSL version to allow when connecting to remote servers. Defaults to `tls1`.

properties.name: maxVersion
properties.description: Can be `tls1.2` or `tls1.3`. The maximum SSL version to allow when connecting to remote servers. Defaults to `tls1.3`.

properties.name: disabledCipherSuites
properties.description: List of cipher suites which should be explicitly prevented from being used in addition to those disabled by the net built-in policy. Supported literal forms: 0xAABB, where AA is `cipher_suite[0]` and BB is `cipher_suite[1]`, as defined in RFC 2246, Section 7.4.1.2. Unrecognized but parsable cipher suites in this form will not return an error. Ex: To disable TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5, specify 0x0004, while to disable TLS_ECDH_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA, specify 0xC002. Note that TLSv1.3 ciphers cannot be disabled using this mechanism.

instanceMethods.name: getBlobData
instanceMethods.description: resolves with blob data.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Valid UUID.

instanceMethods.name: downloadURL
instanceMethods.description:
Initiates a download of the resource at `url`. The API will generate a DownloadItem that can be accessed with the will-download event.

**Note:** This does not perform any security checks that relate to a page's origin, unlike `webContents.downloadURL`.

instanceMethods.name: createInterruptedDownload
instanceMethods.description: Allows resuming `cancelled` or `interrupted` downloads from previous `Session`. The API will generate a DownloadItem that can be accessed with the will-download event. The DownloadItem will not have any `WebContents` associated with it and the initial state will be `interrupted`. The download will start only when the `resume` API is called on the DownloadItem.

properties.name: path
properties.description: Absolute path of the download.

properties.name: urlChain
properties.description: Complete URL chain for the download.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Start range for the download.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Total length of the download.

properties.name: lastModified
properties.description: Last-Modified header value.

properties.name: eTag
properties.description: ETag header value.

properties.name: startTime
properties.description: Time when download was started in number of seconds since UNIX epoch.

instanceMethods.name: clearAuthCache
instanceMethods.description: resolves when the session’s HTTP authentication cache has been cleared.

instanceMethods.name: setPreloads
instanceMethods.description: Adds scripts that will be executed on ALL web contents that are associated with this session just before normal `preload` scripts run.

parameters.name: preloads
parameters.description: An array of absolute path to preload scripts

instanceMethods.name: getPreloads
instanceMethods.description: an array of paths to preload scripts that have been registered.

instanceMethods.name: setSpellCheckerEnabled
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether to enable the builtin spell checker.

instanceMethods.name: isSpellCheckerEnabled
instanceMethods.description: Whether the builtin spell checker is enabled.

instanceMethods.name: setSpellCheckerLanguages
instanceMethods.description:
The built in spellchecker does not automatically detect what language a user is typing in.  In order for the spell checker to correctly check their words you must call this API with an array of language codes.  You can get the list of supported language codes with the `ses.availableSpellCheckerLanguages` property.

**Note:** On macOS the OS spellchecker is used and will detect your language automatically.  This API is a no-op on macOS.

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: An array of language codes to enable the spellchecker for.

instanceMethods.name: getSpellCheckerLanguages
instanceMethods.description:
An array of language codes the spellchecker is enabled for.  If this list is empty the spellchecker will fallback to using `en-US`.  By default on launch if this setting is an empty list Electron will try to populate this setting with the current OS locale.  This setting is persisted across restarts.

**Note:** On macOS the OS spellchecker is used and has its own list of languages.  This API is a no-op on macOS.

instanceMethods.name: setSpellCheckerDictionaryDownloadURL
instanceMethods.description:
By default Electron will download hunspell dictionaries from the Chromium CDN.  If you want to override this behavior you can use this API to point the dictionary downloader at your own hosted version of the hunspell dictionaries.  We publish a `hunspell_dictionaries.zip` file with each release which contains the files you need to host here, the file server must be **case insensitive** you must upload each file twice, once with the case it has in the ZIP file and once with the filename as all lower case.

If the files present in `hunspell_dictionaries.zip` are available at `https://example.com/dictionaries/language-code.bdic` then you should call this api with `ses.setSpellCheckerDictionaryDownloadURL('https://example.com/dictionaries/')`.  Please note the trailing slash.  The URL to the dictionaries is formed as `${url}${filename}`.

**Note:** On macOS the OS spellchecker is used and therefore we do not download any dictionary files.  This API is a no-op on macOS.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: A base URL for Electron to download hunspell dictionaries from.

instanceMethods.name: listWordsInSpellCheckerDictionary
instanceMethods.description: An array of all words in app's custom dictionary. Resolves when the full dictionary is loaded from disk.

instanceMethods.name: addWordToSpellCheckerDictionary
instanceMethods.description:
Whether the word was successfully written to the custom dictionary. This API will not work on non-persistent (in-memory) sessions.

**Note:** On macOS and Windows 10 this word will be written to the OS custom dictionary as well

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: The word you want to add to the dictionary

instanceMethods.name: removeWordFromSpellCheckerDictionary
instanceMethods.description:
Whether the word was successfully removed from the custom dictionary. This API will not work on non-persistent (in-memory) sessions.

**Note:** On macOS and Windows 10 this word will be removed from the OS custom dictionary as well

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: The word you want to remove from the dictionary

instanceMethods.name: loadExtension
instanceMethods.description:
resolves when the extension is loaded.

This method will raise an exception if the extension could not be loaded. If there are warnings when installing the extension (e.g. if the extension requests an API that Electron does not support) then they will be logged to the console.

Note that Electron does not support the full range of Chrome extensions APIs. See Supported Extensions APIs for more details on what is supported.

Note that in previous versions of Electron, extensions that were loaded would be remembered for future runs of the application. This is no longer the case: `loadExtension` must be called on every boot of your app if you want the extension to be loaded.

This API does not support loading packed (.crx) extensions.

**Note:** This API cannot be called before the `ready` event of the `app` module is emitted.

**Note:** Loading extensions into in-memory (non-persistent) sessions is not supported and will throw an error.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to a directory containing an unpacked Chrome extension

properties.name: allowFileAccess
properties.description: Whether to allow the extension to read local files over `file://` protocol and inject content scripts into `file://` pages. This is required e.g. for loading devtools extensions on `file://` URLs. Defaults to false.

instanceMethods.name: removeExtension
instanceMethods.description:
Unloads an extension.

**Note:** This API cannot be called before the `ready` event of the `app` module is emitted.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: ID of extension to remove

instanceMethods.name: getExtension
instanceMethods.description:
| `null` - The loaded extension with the given ID.

**Note:** This API cannot be called before the `ready` event of the `app` module is emitted.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: ID of extension to query

instanceMethods.name: getAllExtensions
instanceMethods.description:
A list of all loaded extensions.

**Note:** This API cannot be called before the `ready` event of the `app` module is emitted.

instanceMethods.name: getStoragePath
instanceMethods.description: A `String | null` indicating the absolute file system path where data for this session is persisted on disk.  For in memory sessions this returns `null`.

instanceProperties.name: availableSpellCheckerLanguages
instanceProperties.description: A `String[]` array which consists of all the known available spell checker languages.  Providing a language code to the `setSpellCheckerLanguages` API that isn't in this array will result in an error.

instanceProperties.name: spellCheckerEnabled
instanceProperties.description: A `Boolean` indicating whether builtin spell checker is enabled.

instanceProperties.name: storagePath
instanceProperties.description: A `String | null` indicating the absolute file system path where data for this session is persisted on disk.  For in memory sessions this returns `null`.

instanceProperties.name: cookies
instanceProperties.description: A `Cookies` object for this session.

instanceProperties.name: serviceWorkers
instanceProperties.description: A `ServiceWorkers` object for this session.

instanceProperties.name: webRequest
instanceProperties.description: A `WebRequest` object for this session.

instanceProperties.name: protocol
instanceProperties.description: A `Protocol` object for this session.

instanceProperties.name: netLog
instanceProperties.description: A `NetLog` object for this session.

instanceEvents.name: will-download
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when Electron is about to download `item` in `webContents`.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will cancel the download and `item` will not be available from next tick of the process.

instanceEvents.name: extension-loaded
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted after an extension is loaded. This occurs whenever an extension is added to the "enabled" set of extensions. This includes:

* Extensions being loaded from `Session.loadExtension`.
* Extensions being reloaded:
  * from a crash.
  * if the extension requested it (`chrome.runtime.reload()`).

instanceEvents.name: extension-unloaded
instanceEvents.description: Emitted after an extension is unloaded. This occurs when `Session.removeExtension` is called.

instanceEvents.name: extension-ready
instanceEvents.description: Emitted after an extension is loaded and all necessary browser state is initialized to support the start of the extension's background page.

instanceEvents.name: preconnect
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a render process requests preconnection to a URL, generally due to a resource hint.

parameters.name: preconnectUrl
parameters.description: The URL being requested for preconnection by the renderer.

parameters.name: allowCredentials
parameters.description: True if the renderer is requesting that the connection include credentials (see the spec for more details.)

instanceEvents.name: spellcheck-dictionary-initialized
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a hunspell dictionary file has been successfully initialized. This occurs after the file has been downloaded.

parameters.name: languageCode
parameters.description: The language code of the dictionary file

instanceEvents.name: spellcheck-dictionary-download-begin
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a hunspell dictionary file starts downloading

parameters.name: languageCode
parameters.description: The language code of the dictionary file

instanceEvents.name: spellcheck-dictionary-download-success
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a hunspell dictionary file has been successfully downloaded

parameters.name: languageCode
parameters.description: The language code of the dictionary file

instanceEvents.name: spellcheck-dictionary-download-failure
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a hunspell dictionary file download fails.  For details on the failure you should collect a netlog and inspect the download request.

parameters.name: languageCode
parameters.description: The language code of the dictionary file

instanceEvents.name: select-serial-port
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a serial port needs to be selected when a call to `navigator.serial.requestPort` is made. `callback` should be called with `portId` to be selected, passing an empty string to `callback` will cancel the request.  Additionally, permissioning on `navigator.serial` can be managed by using ses.setPermissionCheckHandler(handler) with the `serial` permission.

Because this is an experimental feature it is disabled by default.  To enable this feature, you will need to use the `--enable-features=ElectronSerialChooser` command line switch.  Additionally because this is an experimental Chromium feature you will need to set `enableBlinkFeatures: 'Serial'` on the `webPreferences` property when opening a BrowserWindow.

instanceEvents.name: serial-port-added
instanceEvents.description: Emitted after `navigator.serial.requestPort` has been called and `select-serial-port` has fired if a new serial port becomes available.  For example, this event will fire when a new USB device is plugged in.

instanceEvents.name: serial-port-removed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted after `navigator.serial.requestPort` has been called and `select-serial-port` has fired if a serial port has been removed.  For example, this event will fire when a USB device is unplugged.

name: ShareMenu
description:
The `ShareMenu` class creates Share Menu on macOS, which can be used to share information from the current context to apps, social media accounts, and other services.

For including the share menu as a submenu of other menus, please use the `shareMenu` role of `MenuItem`.

### Class: ShareMenu

> Create share menu on macOS.

Process: Main

parameters.name: sharingItem
parameters.description: The item to share.

instanceMethods.name: popup
instanceMethods.description: Pops up this menu as a context menu in the `BrowserWindow`.

instanceMethods.name: closePopup
instanceMethods.description: Closes the context menu in the `browserWindow`.

parameters.name: browserWindow
parameters.description: Default is the focused window.

name: shell
description:
> Manage files and URLs using their default applications.

Process: Main, Renderer (non-sandboxed only)

The `shell` module provides functions related to desktop integration.

An example of opening a URL in the user's default browser:

```
const { shell } = require('electron')

shell.openExternal('https://github.com')
```

**Note:** While the `shell` module can be used in the renderer process, it will not function in a sandboxed renderer.

methods.name: showItemInFolder
methods.description: Show the given file in a file manager. If possible, select the file.

methods.name: openPath
methods.description:
Resolves with a string containing the error message corresponding to the failure if a failure occurred, otherwise "".

Open the given file in the desktop's default manner.

methods.name: openExternal
methods.description: Open the given external protocol URL in the desktop's default manner. (For example, mailto: URLs in the user's default mail agent).

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Max 2081 characters on windows.

properties.name: activate
properties.description: `true` to bring the opened application to the foreground. The default is `true`.

properties.name: workingDirectory
properties.description: The working directory.

methods.name: trashItem
methods.description:
Resolves when the operation has been completed. Rejects if there was an error while deleting the requested item.

This moves a path to the OS-specific trash location (Trash on macOS, Recycle Bin on Windows, and a desktop-environment-specific location on Linux).

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: path to the item to be moved to the trash.

methods.name: beep
methods.description: Play the beep sound.

methods.name: writeShortcutLink
methods.description:
Whether the shortcut was created successfully.

Creates or updates a shortcut link at `shortcutPath`.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Default is `create`, can be one of following:

possibleValues.description: Creates a new shortcut, overwriting if necessary.
Updates specified properties only on an existing shortcut.
Overwrites an existing shortcut, fails if the shortcut doesn't exist.

methods.name: readShortcutLink
methods.description:
Resolves the shortcut link at `shortcutPath`.

An exception will be thrown when any error happens.

name: systemPreferences
description:
> Get system preferences.

Process: Main

methods.name: isDarkMode
methods.description:
Whether the system is in Dark Mode.

**Deprecated:** Should use the new `nativeTheme.shouldUseDarkColors` API.

methods.name: isSwipeTrackingFromScrollEventsEnabled
methods.description: Whether the Swipe between pages setting is on.

methods.name: postNotification
methods.description: Posts `event` as native notifications of macOS. The `userInfo` is an Object that contains the user information dictionary sent along with the notification.

parameters.name: deliverImmediately
parameters.description: `true` to post notifications immediately even when the subscribing app is inactive.

methods.name: postLocalNotification
methods.description: Posts `event` as native notifications of macOS. The `userInfo` is an Object that contains the user information dictionary sent along with the notification.

methods.name: postWorkspaceNotification
methods.description: Posts `event` as native notifications of macOS. The `userInfo` is an Object that contains the user information dictionary sent along with the notification.

methods.name: subscribeNotification
methods.description:
The ID of this subscription

Subscribes to native notifications of macOS, `callback` will be called with `callback(event, userInfo)` when the corresponding `event` happens. The `userInfo` is an Object that contains the user information dictionary sent along with the notification. The `object` is the sender of the notification, and only supports `NSString` values for now.

The `id` of the subscriber is returned, which can be used to unsubscribe the `event`.

Under the hood this API subscribes to `NSDistributedNotificationCenter`, example values of `event` are:

* `AppleInterfaceThemeChangedNotification`
* `AppleAquaColorVariantChanged`
* `AppleColorPreferencesChangedNotification`
* `AppleShowScrollBarsSettingChanged`

methods.name: subscribeLocalNotification
methods.description:
The ID of this subscription

Same as `subscribeNotification`, but uses `NSNotificationCenter` for local defaults. This is necessary for events such as `NSUserDefaultsDidChangeNotification`.

methods.name: subscribeWorkspaceNotification
methods.description:
The ID of this subscription

Same as `subscribeNotification`, but uses `NSWorkspace.sharedWorkspace.notificationCenter`. This is necessary for events such as `NSWorkspaceDidActivateApplicationNotification`.

methods.name: unsubscribeNotification
methods.description: Removes the subscriber with `id`.

methods.name: unsubscribeLocalNotification
methods.description: Same as `unsubscribeNotification`, but removes the subscriber from `NSNotificationCenter`.

methods.name: unsubscribeWorkspaceNotification
methods.description: Same as `unsubscribeNotification`, but removes the subscriber from `NSWorkspace.sharedWorkspace.notificationCenter`.

methods.name: registerDefaults
methods.description: Add the specified defaults to your application's `NSUserDefaults`.

parameters.name: defaults
parameters.description: a dictionary of (`key: value`) user defaults

methods.name: getUserDefault
methods.description:
The value of `key` in `NSUserDefaults`.

Some popular `key` and `type`s are:

* `AppleInterfaceStyle`: `string`
* `AppleAquaColorVariant`: `integer`
* `AppleHighlightColor`: `string`
* `AppleShowScrollBars`: `string`
* `NSNavRecentPlaces`: `array`
* `NSPreferredWebServices`: `dictionary`
* `NSUserDictionaryReplacementItems`: `array`

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Can be `string`, `boolean`, `integer`, `float`, `double`, `url`, `array` or `dictionary`.

methods.name: setUserDefault
methods.description:
Set the value of `key` in `NSUserDefaults`.

Note that `type` should match actual type of `value`. An exception is thrown if they don't.

Some popular `key` and `type`s are:

* `ApplePressAndHoldEnabled`: `boolean`

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Can be `string`, `boolean`, `integer`, `float`, `double`, `url`, `array` or `dictionary`.

methods.name: removeUserDefault
methods.description: Removes the `key` in `NSUserDefaults`. This can be used to restore the default or global value of a `key` previously set with `setUserDefault`.

methods.name: isAeroGlassEnabled
methods.description:
`true` if DWM composition (Aero Glass) is enabled, and `false` otherwise.

An example of using it to determine if you should create a transparent window or not (transparent windows won't work correctly when DWM composition is disabled):

methods.name: getAccentColor
methods.description:
The users current system wide accent color preference in RGBA hexadecimal form.

This API is only available on macOS 10.14 Mojave or newer.

methods.name: getColor
methods.description:
The system color setting in RGB hexadecimal form (`#ABCDEF`). See the Windows docs and the macOS docs for more details.

The following colors are only available on macOS 10.14: `find-highlight`, `selected-content-background`, `separator`, `unemphasized-selected-content-background`, `unemphasized-selected-text-background`, and `unemphasized-selected-text`.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: One of the following values:

possibleValues.description: Dark shadow for three-dimensional display elements.
Face color for three-dimensional display elements and for dialog box backgrounds.
Highlight color for three-dimensional display elements.
Light color for three-dimensional display elements.
Shadow color for three-dimensional display elements.
Active window border.
Active window title bar. Specifies the left side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled.
Right side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar.
Background color of multiple document interface (MDI) applications.
Text on push buttons.
Text in caption, size box, and scroll bar arrow box.
Desktop background color.
Grayed (disabled) text.
Item(s) selected in a control.
Text of item(s) selected in a control.
Color for a hyperlink or hot-tracked item.
Inactive window border.
Inactive window caption. Specifies the left side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled.
Right side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar.
Color of text in an inactive caption.
Background color for tooltip controls.
Text color for tooltip controls.
Menu background.
The color used to highlight menu items when the menu appears as a flat menu.
The background color for the menu bar when menus appear as flat menus.
Text in menus.
Scroll bar gray area.
Window background.
Window frame.
Text in windows.
The text on a selected surface in a list or table. _deprecated_
The background of a large interface element, such as a browser or table.
The surface of a control.
The text of a control that isn’t disabled.
The text of a control that’s disabled.
The color of a find indicator.
The gridlines of an interface element such as a table.
The text of a header cell in a table.
The virtual light source onscreen.
The ring that appears around the currently focused control when using the keyboard for interface navigation.
The text of a label containing primary content.
A link to other content.
A placeholder string in a control or text view.
The text of a label of lesser importance than a tertiary label such as watermark text.
The background of a scrubber in the Touch Bar.
The text of a label of lesser importance than a normal label such as a label used to represent a subheading or additional information.
The background for selected content in a key window or view.
The surface of a selected control.
The text of a selected control.
The text of a selected menu.
The background of selected text.
Selected text.
A separator between different sections of content.
The virtual shadow cast by a raised object onscreen.
The text of a label of lesser importance than a secondary label such as a label used to represent disabled text.
Text background.
The text in a document.
The background behind a document's content.
The selected content in a non-key window or view.
A background for selected text in a non-key window or view.
Selected text in a non-key window or view.
The background of a window.
The text in the window's titlebar area.

methods.name: getSystemColor
methods.description:
The standard system color formatted as `#RRGGBBAA`.

Returns one of several standard system colors that automatically adapt to vibrancy and changes in accessibility settings like 'Increase contrast' and 'Reduce transparency'. See Apple Documentation for  more details.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: One of the following values:

methods.name: isInvertedColorScheme
methods.description:
`true` if an inverted color scheme (a high contrast color scheme with light text and dark backgrounds) is active, `false` otherwise.

**Deprecated:** Should use the new `nativeTheme.shouldUseInvertedColorScheme` API.

methods.name: isHighContrastColorScheme
methods.description:
`true` if a high contrast theme is active, `false` otherwise.

**Deprecated:** Should use the new `nativeTheme.shouldUseHighContrastColors` API.

methods.name: getEffectiveAppearance
methods.description:
Can be `dark`, `light` or `unknown`.

Gets the macOS appearance setting that is currently applied to your application, maps to NSApplication.effectiveAppearance

methods.name: getAppLevelAppearance
methods.description:
| `null` - Can be `dark`, `light` or `unknown`.

Gets the macOS appearance setting that you have declared you want for your application, maps to NSApplication.appearance. You can use the `setAppLevelAppearance` API to set this value.

methods.name: setAppLevelAppearance
methods.description: Sets the appearance setting for your application, this should override the system default and override the value of `getEffectiveAppearance`.

parameters.name: appearance
parameters.description: Can be `dark` or `light`

methods.name: canPromptTouchID
methods.description:
whether or not this device has the ability to use Touch ID.

**NOTE:** This API will return `false` on macOS systems older than Sierra 10.12.2.

methods.name: promptTouchID
methods.description:
resolves if the user has successfully authenticated with Touch ID.

This API itself will not protect your user data; rather, it is a mechanism to allow you to do so. Native apps will need to set Access Control Constants like `kSecAccessControlUserPresence` on their keychain entry so that reading it would auto-prompt for Touch ID biometric consent. This could be done with `node-keytar`, such that one would store an encryption key with `node-keytar` and only fetch it if `promptTouchID()` resolves.

**NOTE:** This API will return a rejected Promise on macOS systems older than Sierra 10.12.2.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason you are asking for Touch ID authentication

methods.name: isTrustedAccessibilityClient
methods.description: `true` if the current process is a trusted accessibility client and `false` if it is not.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: whether or not the user will be informed via prompt if the current process is untrusted.

methods.name: getMediaAccessStatus
methods.description:
Can be `not-determined`, `granted`, `denied`, `restricted` or `unknown`.

This user consent was not required on macOS 10.13 High Sierra or lower so this method will always return `granted`. macOS 10.14 Mojave or higher requires consent for `microphone` and `camera` access. macOS 10.15 Catalina or higher requires consent for `screen` access.

Windows 10 has a global setting controlling `microphone` and `camera` access for all win32 applications. It will always return `granted` for `screen` and for all media types on older versions of Windows.

parameters.name: mediaType
parameters.description: Can be `microphone`, `camera` or `screen`.

methods.name: askForMediaAccess
methods.description:
A promise that resolves with `true` if consent was granted and `false` if it was denied. If an invalid `mediaType` is passed, the promise will be rejected. If an access request was denied and later is changed through the System Preferences pane, a restart of the app will be required for the new permissions to take effect. If access has already been requested and denied, it _must_ be changed through the preference pane; an alert will not pop up and the promise will resolve with the existing access status.

**Important:** In order to properly leverage this API, you must set the `NSMicrophoneUsageDescription` and `NSCameraUsageDescription` strings in your app's `Info.plist` file. The values for these keys will be used to populate the permission dialogs so that the user will be properly informed as to the purpose of the permission request. See Electron Application Distribution for more information about how to set these in the context of Electron.

This user consent was not required until macOS 10.14 Mojave, so this method will always return `true` if your system is running 10.13 High Sierra or lower.

* `scrollAnimationsEnabledBySystem` Boolean - Determines on a per-platform basis whether scroll animations (e.g. produced by home/end key) should be enabled.
* `prefersReducedMotion` Boolean - Determines whether the user desires reduced motion based on platform APIs.

Returns an object with system animation settings.

name: Tray
description:
### Class: Tray

> Add icons and context menus to the system's notification area.

Process: Main

`Tray` is an EventEmitter.

```
const { app, Menu, Tray } = require('electron')

let tray = null
app.whenReady().then(() => {
  tray = new Tray('/path/to/my/icon')
  const contextMenu = Menu.buildFromTemplate([
    { label: 'Item1', type: 'radio' },
    { label: 'Item2', type: 'radio' },
    { label: 'Item3', type: 'radio', checked: true },
    { label: 'Item4', type: 'radio' }
  ])
  tray.setToolTip('This is my application.')
  tray.setContextMenu(contextMenu)
})
```

__Platform limitations:__

* On Linux the app indicator will be used if it is supported, otherwise `GtkStatusIcon` will be used instead.
* On Linux distributions that only have app indicator support, you have to install `libappindicator1` to make the tray icon work.
* App indicator will only be shown when it has a context menu.
* When app indicator is used on Linux, the `click` event is ignored.
* On Linux in order for changes made to individual `MenuItem`s to take effect, you have to call `setContextMenu` again. For example:

```
const { app, Menu, Tray } = require('electron')

let appIcon = null
app.whenReady().then(() => {
  appIcon = new Tray('/path/to/my/icon')
  const contextMenu = Menu.buildFromTemplate([
    { label: 'Item1', type: 'radio' },
    { label: 'Item2', type: 'radio' }
  ])

  // Make a change to the context menu
  contextMenu.items[1].checked = false

  // Call this again for Linux because we modified the context menu
  appIcon.setContextMenu(contextMenu)
})
```

* On Windows it is recommended to use `ICO` icons to get best visual effects.

If you want to keep exact same behaviors on all platforms, you should not rely on the `click` event and always attach a context menu to the tray icon.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Assigns a GUID to the tray icon. If the executable is signed and the signature contains an organization in the subject line then the GUID is permanently associated with that signature. OS level settings like the position of the tray icon in the system tray will persist even if the path to the executable changes. If the executable is not code-signed then the GUID is permanently associated with the path to the executable. Changing the path to the executable will break the creation of the tray icon and a new GUID must be used. However, it is highly recommended to use the GUID parameter only in conjunction with code-signed executable. If an App defines multiple tray icons then each icon must use a separate GUID.

instanceMethods.name: isCrashed
instanceMethods.description: Whether the renderer process has crashed.

instanceMethods.name: forcefullyCrashRenderer
instanceMethods.description:
Forcefully terminates the renderer process that is currently hosting this `webContents`. This will cause the `render-process-gone` event to be emitted with the `reason=killed || reason=crashed`. Please note that some webContents share renderer processes and therefore calling this method may also crash the host process for other webContents as well.

Calling `reload()` immediately after calling this method will force the reload to occur in a new process. This should be used when this process is unstable or unusable, for instance in order to recover from the `unresponsive` event.

instanceMethods.name: setUserAgent
instanceMethods.description: Overrides the user agent for this web page.

instanceMethods.name: getUserAgent
instanceMethods.description: The user agent for this web page.

instanceMethods.name: insertCSS
instanceMethods.description:
A promise that resolves with a key for the inserted CSS that can later be used to remove the CSS via `contents.removeInsertedCSS(key)`.

Injects CSS into the current web page and returns a unique key for the inserted stylesheet.

properties.name: cssOrigin
properties.description: Can be either 'user' or 'author'; Specifying 'user' enables you to prevent websites from overriding the CSS you insert. Default is 'author'.

instanceMethods.name: removeInsertedCSS
instanceMethods.description:
Resolves if the removal was successful.

Removes the inserted CSS from the current web page. The stylesheet is identified by its key, which is returned from `contents.insertCSS(css)`.

instanceMethods.name: executeJavaScript
instanceMethods.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if the result of the code is a rejected promise.

Evaluates `code` in page.

In the browser window some HTML APIs like `requestFullScreen` can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting `userGesture` to `true` will remove this limitation.

Code execution will be suspended until web page stop loading.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Default is `false`.

instanceMethods.name: executeJavaScriptInIsolatedWorld
instanceMethods.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if the result of the code is a rejected promise.

Works like `executeJavaScript` but evaluates `scripts` in an isolated context.

parameters.name: worldId
parameters.description: The ID of the world to run the javascript in, `0` is the default world, `999` is the world used by Electron's `contextIsolation` feature.  You can provide any integer here.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Default is `false`.

instanceMethods.name: setIgnoreMenuShortcuts
instanceMethods.description: Ignore application menu shortcuts while this web contents is focused.

instanceMethods.name: setWindowOpenHandler
instanceMethods.description: Called before creating a window when `window.open()` is called from the renderer. See `window.open()` for more details and how to use this in conjunction with `did-create-window`.

properties.name: url
properties.description: The _resolved_ version of the URL passed to `window.open()`. e.g. opening a window with `window.open('foo')` will yield something like `https://the-origin/the/current/path/foo`.

properties.name: frameName
properties.description: Name of the window provided in `window.open()`

properties.name: features
properties.description: Comma separated list of window features provided to `window.open()`.

properties.name: disposition
properties.description: Can be `default`, `foreground-tab`, `background-tab`, `new-window`, `save-to-disk` or `other`.

properties.name: referrer
properties.description: The referrer that will be passed to the new window. May or may not result in the `Referer` header being sent, depending on the referrer policy.

properties.name: postBody
properties.description: The post data that will be sent to the new window, along with the appropriate headers that will be set. If no post data is to be sent, the value will be `null`. Only defined when the window is being created by a form that set `target=_blank`.

instanceMethods.name: setAudioMuted
instanceMethods.description: Mute the audio on the current web page.

instanceMethods.name: isAudioMuted
instanceMethods.description: Whether this page has been muted.

instanceMethods.name: isCurrentlyAudible
instanceMethods.description: Whether audio is currently playing.

instanceMethods.name: setZoomFactor
instanceMethods.description:
Changes the zoom factor to the specified factor. Zoom factor is zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0.

The factor must be greater than 0.0.

parameters.name: factor
parameters.description: Zoom factor; default is 1.0.

instanceMethods.name: getZoomFactor
instanceMethods.description: the current zoom factor.

instanceMethods.name: setZoomLevel
instanceMethods.description:
Changes the zoom level to the specified level. The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively. The formula for this is `scale := 1.2 ^ level`.

> **NOTE**: The zoom policy at the Chromium level is same-origin, meaning that the zoom level for a specific domain propagates across all instances of windows with the same domain. Differentiating the window URLs will make zoom work per-window.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Zoom level.

instanceMethods.name: getZoomLevel
instanceMethods.description: the current zoom level.

instanceMethods.name: setVisualZoomLevelLimits
instanceMethods.description:
Sets the maximum and minimum pinch-to-zoom level.

> **NOTE**: Visual zoom is disabled by default in Electron. To re-enable it, call:

instanceMethods.name: undo
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `undo` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: redo
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `redo` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: cut
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `cut` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: copy
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `copy` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: copyImageAt

instanceMethods.name: paste
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `paste` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: pasteAndMatchStyle
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `pasteAndMatchStyle` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: delete
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `delete` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: selectAll
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `selectAll` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: replaceMisspelling

instanceMethods.name: insertText
instanceMethods.description: Inserts `text` to the focused element.

instanceMethods.name: findInPage
instanceMethods.description:
The request id used for the request.

Starts a request to find all matches for the `text` in the web page. The result of the request can be obtained by subscribing to `found-in-page` event.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Content to be searched, must not be empty.

properties.name: forward
properties.description: Whether to search forward or backward, defaults to `true`.

properties.name: findNext
properties.description: Whether to begin a new text finding session with this request. Should be `true` for initial requests, and `false` for follow-up requests. Defaults to `false`.

properties.name: matchCase
properties.description: Whether search should be case-sensitive, defaults to `false`.

instanceMethods.name: stopFindInPage
instanceMethods.description: Stops any `findInPage` request for the `webContents` with the provided `action`.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Specifies the action to take place when ending [`webContents.findInPage`] request.

possibleValues.description: Clear the selection.
Translate the selection into a normal selection.
Focus and click the selection node.

instanceMethods.name: capturePage
instanceMethods.description:
Resolves with a NativeImage

Captures a snapshot of the page within `rect`. Omitting `rect` will capture the whole visible page.

parameters.name: rect
parameters.description: The area of the page to be captured.

instanceMethods.name: isBeingCaptured
instanceMethods.description: Whether this page is being captured. It returns true when the capturer count is large then 0.

instanceMethods.name: incrementCapturerCount
instanceMethods.description:
Increase the capturer count by one. The page is considered visible when its browser window is hidden and the capturer count is non-zero. If you would like the page to stay hidden, you should ensure that `stayHidden` is set to true.

This also affects the Page Visibility API.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The preferred size for the capturer.

parameters.name: stayHidden
parameters.description: Keep the page hidden instead of visible.

parameters.name: stayAwake
parameters.description: Keep the system awake instead of allowing it to sleep.

instanceMethods.name: decrementCapturerCount
instanceMethods.description: Decrease the capturer count by one. The page will be set to hidden or occluded state when its browser window is hidden or occluded and the capturer count reaches zero. If you want to decrease the hidden capturer count instead you should set `stayHidden` to true.

parameters.name: stayHidden
parameters.description: Keep the page in hidden state instead of visible.

parameters.name: stayAwake
parameters.description: Keep the system awake instead of allowing it to sleep.

instanceMethods.name: getPrinters
instanceMethods.description: Get the system printer list.

instanceMethods.name: print
instanceMethods.description:
When a custom `pageSize` is passed, Chromium attempts to validate platform specific minimum values for `width_microns` and `height_microns`. Width and height must both be minimum 353 microns but may be higher on some operating systems.

Prints window's web page. When `silent` is set to `true`, Electron will pick the system's default printer if `deviceName` is empty and the default settings for printing.

Use `page-break-before: always;` CSS style to force to print to a new page.

Example usage:

properties.name: silent
properties.description: Don't ask user for print settings. Default is `false`.

properties.name: printBackground
properties.description: Prints the background color and image of the web page. Default is `false`.

properties.name: deviceName
properties.description: Set the printer device name to use. Must be the system-defined name and not the 'friendly' name, e.g 'Brother_QL_820NWB' and not 'Brother QL-820NWB'.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Set whether the printed web page will be in color or grayscale. Default is `true`.

properties.name: marginType
properties.description: Can be `default`, `none`, `printableArea`, or `custom`. If `custom` is chosen, you will also need to specify `top`, `bottom`, `left`, and `right`.

properties.name: top
properties.description: The top margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: The bottom margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: left
properties.description: The left margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: right
properties.description: The right margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: landscape
properties.description: Whether the web page should be printed in landscape mode. Default is `false`.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: The scale factor of the web page.

properties.name: pagesPerSheet
properties.description: The number of pages to print per page sheet.

properties.name: collate
properties.description: Whether the web page should be collated.

properties.name: copies
properties.description: The number of copies of the web page to print.

properties.name: pageRanges
properties.description: The page range to print. On macOS, only one range is honored.

properties.name: from
properties.description: Index of the first page to print (0-based).

properties.name: to
properties.description: Index of the last page to print (inclusive) (0-based).

properties.name: duplexMode
properties.description: Set the duplex mode of the printed web page. Can be `simplex`, `shortEdge`, or `longEdge`.

properties.name: header
properties.description: String to be printed as page header.

properties.name: footer
properties.description: String to be printed as page footer.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: Specify page size of the printed document. Can be `A3`, `A4`, `A5`, `Legal`, `Letter`, `Tabloid` or an Object containing `height`.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: Indicates success of the print call.

parameters.name: failureReason
parameters.description: Error description called back if the print fails.

instanceMethods.name: printToPDF
instanceMethods.description:
Resolves with the generated PDF data.

Prints window's web page as PDF with Chromium's preview printing custom settings.

The `landscape` will be ignored if `@page` CSS at-rule is used in the web page.

By default, an empty `options` will be regarded as:

Use `page-break-before: always;` CSS style to force to print to a new page.

An example of `webContents.printToPDF`:

properties.name: headerFooter
properties.description: the header and footer for the PDF.

properties.name: landscape
properties.description: `true` for landscape, `false` for portrait.

properties.name: marginsType
properties.description: Specifies the type of margins to use. Uses 0 for default margin, 1 for no margin, and 2 for minimum margin.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: The scale factor of the web page. Can range from 0 to 100.

properties.name: pageRanges
properties.description: The page range to print.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: Specify page size of the generated PDF. Can be `A3`, `A4`, `A5`, `Legal`, `Letter`, `Tabloid` or an Object containing `height` and `width` in microns.

properties.name: printBackground
properties.description: Whether to print CSS backgrounds.

properties.name: printSelectionOnly
properties.description: Whether to print selection only.

instanceMethods.name: addWorkSpace
instanceMethods.description: Adds the specified path to DevTools workspace. Must be used after DevTools creation:

instanceMethods.name: removeWorkSpace
instanceMethods.description: Removes the specified path from DevTools workspace.

instanceMethods.name: setDevToolsWebContents
instanceMethods.description:
Uses the `devToolsWebContents` as the target `WebContents` to show devtools.

The `devToolsWebContents` must not have done any navigation, and it should not be used for other purposes after the call.

By default Electron manages the devtools by creating an internal `WebContents` with native view, which developers have very limited control of. With the `setDevToolsWebContents` method, developers can use any `WebContents` to show the devtools in it, including `BrowserWindow`, `BrowserView` and `<webview>` tag.

Note that closing the devtools does not destroy the `devToolsWebContents`, it is caller's responsibility to destroy `devToolsWebContents`.

An example of showing devtools in a `<webview>` tag:

An example of showing devtools in a `BrowserWindow`:

instanceMethods.name: openDevTools
instanceMethods.description:
Opens the devtools.

When `contents` is a `<webview>` tag, the `mode` would be `detach` by default, explicitly passing an empty `mode` can force using last used dock state.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Opens the devtools with specified dock state, can be `right`, `bottom`, `undocked`, `detach`. Defaults to last used dock state. In `undocked` mode it's possible to dock back. In `detach` mode it's not.

properties.name: activate
properties.description: Whether to bring the opened devtools window to the foreground. The default is `true`.

instanceMethods.name: closeDevTools
instanceMethods.description: Closes the devtools.

instanceMethods.name: isDevToolsOpened
instanceMethods.description: Whether the devtools is opened.

instanceMethods.name: isDevToolsFocused
instanceMethods.description: Whether the devtools view is focused .

instanceMethods.name: toggleDevTools
instanceMethods.description: Toggles the developer tools.

instanceMethods.name: inspectElement
instanceMethods.description: Starts inspecting element at position (`x`, `y`).

instanceMethods.name: inspectSharedWorker
instanceMethods.description: Opens the developer tools for the shared worker context.

instanceMethods.name: inspectSharedWorkerById
instanceMethods.description: Inspects the shared worker based on its ID.

instanceMethods.name: getAllSharedWorkers
instanceMethods.description: Information about all Shared Workers.

instanceMethods.name: inspectServiceWorker
instanceMethods.description: Opens the developer tools for the service worker context.

instanceMethods.name: send
instanceMethods.description:
Send an asynchronous message to the renderer process via `channel`, along with arguments. Arguments will be serialized with the Structured Clone Algorithm, just like `postMessage`, so prototype chains will not be included. Sending Functions, Promises, Symbols, WeakMaps, or WeakSets will throw an exception.

> **NOTE**: Sending non-standard JavaScript types such as DOM objects or special Electron objects will throw an exception.

The renderer process can handle the message by listening to `channel` with the `ipcRenderer` module.

An example of sending messages from the main process to the renderer process:

instanceMethods.name: sendToFrame
instanceMethods.description:
Send an asynchronous message to a specific frame in a renderer process via `channel`, along with arguments. Arguments will be serialized with the Structured Clone Algorithm, just like `postMessage`, so prototype chains will not be included. Sending Functions, Promises, Symbols, WeakMaps, or WeakSets will throw an exception.

> **NOTE:** Sending non-standard JavaScript types such as DOM objects or special Electron objects will throw an exception.

The renderer process can handle the message by listening to `channel` with the `ipcRenderer` module.

If you want to get the `frameId` of a given renderer context you should use the `webFrame.routingId` value.  E.g.

You can also read `frameId` from all incoming IPC messages in the main process.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: the ID of the frame to send to, or a pair of `[processId, frameId]` if the frame is in a different process to the main frame.

instanceMethods.name: postMessage
instanceMethods.description:
Send a message to the renderer process, optionally transferring ownership of zero or more [`MessagePortMain`][] objects.

The transferred `MessagePortMain` objects will be available in the renderer process by accessing the `ports` property of the emitted event. When they arrive in the renderer, they will be native DOM `MessagePort` objects.

For example:

instanceMethods.name: enableDeviceEmulation
instanceMethods.description: Enable device emulation with the given parameters.

properties.name: screenPosition
properties.description: Specify the screen type to emulate (default: `desktop`):

possibleValues.description: Desktop screen type.
Mobile screen type.

properties.name: screenSize
properties.description: Set the emulated screen size (screenPosition == mobile).

properties.name: viewPosition
properties.description: Position the view on the screen (screenPosition == mobile) (default: `{ x: 0, y: 0 }`).

properties.name: deviceScaleFactor
properties.description: Set the device scale factor (if zero defaults to original device scale factor) (default: `0`).

properties.name: viewSize
properties.description: Set the emulated view size (empty means no override)

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Scale of emulated view inside available space (not in fit to view mode) (default: `1`).

instanceMethods.name: disableDeviceEmulation
instanceMethods.description: Disable device emulation enabled by `webContents.enableDeviceEmulation`.

instanceMethods.name: sendInputEvent
instanceMethods.description: Sends an input `event` to the page. **Note:** The `BrowserWindow` containing the contents needs to be focused for `sendInputEvent()` to work.

instanceMethods.name: beginFrameSubscription
instanceMethods.description:
Begin subscribing for presentation events and captured frames, the `callback` will be called with `callback(image, dirtyRect)` when there is a presentation event.

The `image` is an instance of NativeImage that stores the captured frame.

The `dirtyRect` is an object with `x, y, width, height` properties that describes which part of the page was repainted. If `onlyDirty` is set to `true`, `image` will only contain the repainted area. `onlyDirty` defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: onlyDirty
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`.

instanceMethods.name: endFrameSubscription
instanceMethods.description: End subscribing for frame presentation events.

instanceMethods.name: startDrag
instanceMethods.description: Sets the `item` as dragging item for current drag-drop operation, `file` is the absolute path of the file to be dragged, and `icon` is the image showing under the cursor when dragging.

properties.name: file
properties.description: The path(s) to the file(s) being dragged.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The image must be non-empty on macOS.

instanceMethods.name: savePage
instanceMethods.description: resolves if the page is saved.

parameters.name: fullPath
parameters.description: The full file path.

parameters.name: saveType
parameters.description: Specify the save type.

possibleValues.description: Save only the HTML of the page.
Save complete-html page.
Save complete-html page as MHTML.

instanceMethods.name: showDefinitionForSelection
instanceMethods.description: Shows pop-up dictionary that searches the selected word on the page.

instanceMethods.name: isOffscreen
instanceMethods.description: Indicates whether *offscreen rendering* is enabled.

instanceMethods.name: startPainting
instanceMethods.description: If *offscreen rendering* is enabled and not painting, start painting.

instanceMethods.name: stopPainting
instanceMethods.description: If *offscreen rendering* is enabled and painting, stop painting.

instanceMethods.name: isPainting
instanceMethods.description: If *offscreen rendering* is enabled returns whether it is currently painting.

instanceMethods.name: setFrameRate
instanceMethods.description: If *offscreen rendering* is enabled sets the frame rate to the specified number. Only values between 1 and 240 are accepted.

instanceMethods.name: getFrameRate
instanceMethods.description: If *offscreen rendering* is enabled returns the current frame rate.

instanceMethods.name: invalidate
instanceMethods.description:
Schedules a full repaint of the window this web contents is in.

If *offscreen rendering* is enabled invalidates the frame and generates a new one through the `'paint'` event.

instanceMethods.name: getWebRTCIPHandlingPolicy
instanceMethods.description: Returns the WebRTC IP Handling Policy.

instanceMethods.name: setWebRTCIPHandlingPolicy
instanceMethods.description: Setting the WebRTC IP handling policy allows you to control which IPs are exposed via WebRTC. See BrowserLeaks for more details.

parameters.name: policy
parameters.description: Specify the WebRTC IP Handling Policy.

possibleValues.description: Exposes user's public and local IPs. This is the default behavior. When this policy is used, WebRTC has the right to enumerate all interfaces and bind them to discover public interfaces.
Exposes user's public IP, but does not expose user's local IP. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use the default route used by http. This doesn't expose any local addresses.

Exposes user's public and local IPs. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use the default route used by http. This also exposes the associated default private address. Default route is the route chosen by the OS on a multi-homed endpoint.
Does not expose public or local IPs. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use TCP to contact peers or servers unless the proxy server supports UDP.

instanceMethods.name: getOSProcessId
instanceMethods.description: The operating system `pid` of the associated renderer process.

instanceMethods.name: getProcessId
instanceMethods.description: The Chromium internal `pid` of the associated renderer. Can be compared to the `frameProcessId` passed by frame specific navigation events (e.g. `did-frame-navigate`)

instanceMethods.name: takeHeapSnapshot
instanceMethods.description:
Indicates whether the snapshot has been created successfully.

Takes a V8 heap snapshot and saves it to `filePath`.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path to the output file.

instanceMethods.name: getBackgroundThrottling
instanceMethods.description: whether or not this WebContents will throttle animations and timers when the page becomes backgrounded. This also affects the Page Visibility API.

instanceMethods.name: setBackgroundThrottling
instanceMethods.description: Controls whether or not this WebContents will throttle animations and timers when the page becomes backgrounded. This also affects the Page Visibility API.

instanceMethods.name: getType
instanceMethods.description: the type of the webContent. Can be `backgroundPage`, `window`, `browserView`, `remote`, `webview` or `offscreen`.

instanceProperties.name: audioMuted
instanceProperties.description: A `Boolean` property that determines whether this page is muted.

instanceProperties.name: userAgent
instanceProperties.description: A `String` property that determines the user agent for this web page.

instanceProperties.name: zoomLevel
instanceProperties.description:
A `Number` property that determines the zoom level for this web contents.

The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively. The formula for this is `scale := 1.2 ^ level`.

instanceProperties.name: zoomFactor
instanceProperties.description:
A `Number` property that determines the zoom factor for this web contents.

The zoom factor is the zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0.

instanceProperties.name: frameRate
instanceProperties.description:
An `Integer` property that sets the frame rate of the web contents to the specified number. Only values between 1 and 240 are accepted.

Only applicable if *offscreen rendering* is enabled.

instanceProperties.name: id
instanceProperties.description: A `Integer` representing the unique ID of this WebContents. Each ID is unique among all `WebContents` instances of the entire Electron application.

instanceProperties.name: session
instanceProperties.description: A `Session` used by this webContents.

instanceProperties.name: hostWebContents
instanceProperties.description: A `WebContents` instance that might own this `WebContents`.

instanceProperties.name: devToolsWebContents
instanceProperties.description:
A `WebContents | null` property that represents the of DevTools `WebContents` associated with a given `WebContents`.

**Note:** Users should never store this object because it may become `null` when the DevTools has been closed.

instanceProperties.name: debugger
instanceProperties.description: A `Debugger` instance for this webContents.

instanceProperties.name: backgroundThrottling
instanceProperties.description: A `Boolean` property that determines whether or not this WebContents will throttle animations and timers when the page becomes backgrounded. This also affects the Page Visibility API.

instanceProperties.name: mainFrame
instanceProperties.description: A `WebFrameMain` property that represents the top frame of the page's frame hierarchy.

instanceEvents.name: did-finish-load
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the navigation is done, i.e. the spinner of the tab has stopped spinning, and the `onload` event was dispatched.

instanceEvents.name: did-fail-load
instanceEvents.description: This event is like `did-finish-load` but emitted when the load failed. The full list of error codes and their meaning is available here.

instanceEvents.name: did-fail-provisional-load
instanceEvents.description: This event is like `did-fail-load` but emitted when the load was cancelled (e.g. `window.stop()` was invoked).

instanceEvents.name: did-frame-finish-load
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a frame has done navigation.

instanceEvents.name: did-start-loading
instanceEvents.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab started spinning.

instanceEvents.name: did-stop-loading
instanceEvents.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab stopped spinning.

instanceEvents.name: dom-ready
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the document in the given frame is loaded.

instanceEvents.name: page-title-updated
instanceEvents.description: Fired when page title is set during navigation. `explicitSet` is false when title is synthesized from file url.

instanceEvents.name: page-favicon-updated
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when page receives favicon urls.

parameters.name: favicons
parameters.description: Array of URLs.

instanceEvents.name: new-window
instanceEvents.description:
Deprecated in favor of `webContents.setWindowOpenHandler`.

Emitted when the page requests to open a new window for a `url`. It could be requested by `window.open` or an external link like `<a target='_blank'>`.

By default a new `BrowserWindow` will be created for the `url`.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent Electron from automatically creating a new `BrowserWindow`. If you call `event.preventDefault()` and manually create a new `BrowserWindow` then you must set `event.newGuest` to reference the new `BrowserWindow` instance, failing to do so may result in unexpected behavior. For example:

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: Can be `default`, `foreground-tab`, `background-tab`, `new-window`, `save-to-disk` and `other`.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The options which will be used for creating the new `BrowserWindow`.

parameters.name: additionalFeatures
parameters.description: The non-standard features (features not handled by Chromium or Electron) given to `window.open()`.

parameters.name: referrer
parameters.description: The referrer that will be passed to the new window. May or may not result in the `Referer` header being sent, depending on the referrer policy.

parameters.name: postBody
parameters.description: The post data that will be sent to the new window, along with the appropriate headers that will be set. If no post data is to be sent, the value will be `null`. Only defined when the window is being created by a form that set `target=_blank`.

instanceEvents.name: did-create-window
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted _after_ successful creation of a window via `window.open` in the renderer. Not emitted if the creation of the window is canceled from `webContents.setWindowOpenHandler`.

See `window.open()` for more details and how to use this in conjunction with `webContents.setWindowOpenHandler`.

properties.name: url
properties.description: URL for the created window.

properties.name: frameName
properties.description: Name given to the created window in the `window.open()` call.

properties.name: options
properties.description: The options used to create the BrowserWindow. They are merged in increasing precedence: options inherited from the parent, parsed options from the `features` string from `window.open()`, and options given by `webContents.setWindowOpenHandler`. Unrecognized options are not filtered out.

properties.name: additionalFeatures
properties.description: The non-standard features (features not handled Chromium or Electron) _Deprecated_

properties.name: referrer
properties.description: The referrer that will be passed to the new window. May or may not result in the `Referer` header being sent, depending on the referrer policy.

properties.name: postBody
properties.description: The post data that will be sent to the new window, along with the appropriate headers that will be set. If no post data is to be sent, the value will be `null`. Only defined when the window is being created by a form that set `target=_blank`.

properties.name: disposition
properties.description: Can be `default`, `foreground-tab`, `background-tab`, `new-window`, `save-to-disk` and `other`.

instanceEvents.name: will-navigate
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a user or the page wants to start navigation. It can happen when the `window.location` object is changed or a user clicks a link in the page.

This event will not emit when the navigation is started programmatically with APIs like `webContents.loadURL` and `webContents.back`.

It is also not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the navigation.

instanceEvents.name: did-start-navigation
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when any frame (including main) starts navigating. `isInPlace` will be `true` for in-page navigations.

instanceEvents.name: will-redirect
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted as a server side redirect occurs during navigation.  For example a 302 redirect.

This event will be emitted after `did-start-navigation` and always before the `did-redirect-navigation` event for the same navigation.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the navigation (not just the redirect).

instanceEvents.name: did-redirect-navigation
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted after a server side redirect occurs during navigation.  For example a 302 redirect.

This event cannot be prevented, if you want to prevent redirects you should checkout out the `will-redirect` event above.

instanceEvents.name: did-navigate
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a main frame navigation is done.

This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

parameters.name: httpResponseCode
parameters.description: -1 for non HTTP navigations

parameters.name: httpStatusText
parameters.description: empty for non HTTP navigations

instanceEvents.name: did-frame-navigate
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when any frame navigation is done.

This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

parameters.name: httpResponseCode
parameters.description: -1 for non HTTP navigations

parameters.name: httpStatusText
parameters.description: empty for non HTTP navigations,

instanceEvents.name: did-navigate-in-page
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when an in-page navigation happened in any frame.

When in-page navigation happens, the page URL changes but does not cause navigation outside of the page. Examples of this occurring are when anchor links are clicked or when the DOM `hashchange` event is triggered.

instanceEvents.name: will-prevent-unload
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a `beforeunload` event handler is attempting to cancel a page unload.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will ignore the `beforeunload` event handler and allow the page to be unloaded.

instanceEvents.name: crashed
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when the renderer process crashes or is killed.

**Deprecated:** This event is superceded by the `render-process-gone` event which contains more information about why the render process disappeared. It isn't always because it crashed.  The `killed` boolean can be replaced by checking `reason === 'killed'` when you switch to that event.

instanceEvents.name: render-process-gone
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the renderer process unexpectedly disappears.  This is normally because it was crashed or killed.

properties.name: reason
properties.description: The reason the render process is gone.  Possible values:

possibleValues.description: Process exited with an exit code of zero
Process exited with a non-zero exit code
Process was sent a SIGTERM or otherwise killed externally
Process crashed
Process ran out of memory
Process never successfully launched
Windows code integrity checks failed

properties.name: exitCode
properties.description: The exit code of the process, unless `reason` is `launch-failed`, in which case `exitCode` will be a platform-specific launch failure error code.

instanceEvents.name: unresponsive
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the web page becomes unresponsive.

instanceEvents.name: responsive
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the unresponsive web page becomes responsive again.

instanceEvents.name: plugin-crashed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a plugin process has crashed.

instanceEvents.name: destroyed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `webContents` is destroyed.

instanceEvents.name: before-input-event
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted before dispatching the `keydown` and `keyup` events in the page. Calling `event.preventDefault` will prevent the page `keydown`/`keyup` events and the menu shortcuts.

To only prevent the menu shortcuts, use `setIgnoreMenuShortcuts`:

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Input properties.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Either `keyUp` or `keyDown`.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.key.

properties.name: code
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.code.

properties.name: isAutoRepeat
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.repeat.

properties.name: isComposing
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.isComposing.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.shiftKey.

properties.name: control
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.controlKey.

properties.name: alt
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.altKey.

properties.name: meta
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.metaKey.

instanceEvents.name: enter-html-full-screen
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the window enters a full-screen state triggered by HTML API.

instanceEvents.name: leave-html-full-screen
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the window leaves a full-screen state triggered by HTML API.

instanceEvents.name: zoom-changed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the user is requesting to change the zoom level using the mouse wheel.

parameters.name: zoomDirection
parameters.description: Can be `in` or `out`.

instanceEvents.name: devtools-opened
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when DevTools is opened.

instanceEvents.name: devtools-closed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when DevTools is closed.

instanceEvents.name: devtools-focused
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when DevTools is focused / opened.

instanceEvents.name: certificate-error
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when failed to verify the `certificate` for `url`.

The usage is the same with the `certificate-error` event of `app`.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: The error code.

parameters.name: isTrusted
