parameters.description: Indicates whether the certificate can be considered trusted.

instanceEvents.name: select-client-certificate
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a client certificate is requested.

The usage is the same with the `select-client-certificate` event of `app`.

parameters.name: certificate
parameters.description: Must be a certificate from the given list.

instanceEvents.name: login
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when `webContents` wants to do basic auth.

The usage is the same with the `login` event of `app`.

instanceEvents.name: found-in-page
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a result is available for [`webContents.findInPage`] request.

properties.name: activeMatchOrdinal
properties.description: Position of the active match.

properties.name: matches
properties.description: Number of Matches.

properties.name: selectionArea
properties.description: Coordinates of first match region.

instanceEvents.name: media-started-playing
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when media starts playing.

instanceEvents.name: media-paused
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when media is paused or done playing.

instanceEvents.name: did-change-theme-color
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a page's theme color changes. This is usually due to encountering a meta tag:

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Theme color is in format of '#rrggbb'. It is `null` when no theme color is set.

instanceEvents.name: update-target-url
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when mouse moves over a link or the keyboard moves the focus to a link.

instanceEvents.name: cursor-changed
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when the cursor's type changes. The `type` parameter can be `default`, `crosshair`, `pointer`, `text`, `wait`, `help`, `e-resize`, `n-resize`, `ne-resize`, `nw-resize`, `s-resize`, `se-resize`, `sw-resize`, `w-resize`, `ns-resize`, `ew-resize`, `nesw-resize`, `nwse-resize`, `col-resize`, `row-resize`, `m-panning`, `e-panning`, `n-panning`, `ne-panning`, `nw-panning`, `s-panning`, `se-panning`, `sw-panning`, `w-panning`, `move`, `vertical-text`, `cell`, `context-menu`, `alias`, `progress`, `nodrop`, `copy`, `none`, `not-allowed`, `zoom-in`, `zoom-out`, `grab`, `grabbing` or `custom`.

If the `type` parameter is `custom`, the `image` parameter will hold the custom cursor image in a `NativeImage`, and `scale`, `size` and `hotspot` will hold additional information about the custom cursor.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: scaling factor for the custom cursor.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the size of the `image`.

parameters.name: hotspot
parameters.description: coordinates of the custom cursor's hotspot.

instanceEvents.name: context-menu
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when there is a new context menu that needs to be handled.

properties.name: x
properties.description: x coordinate.

properties.name: y
properties.description: y coordinate.

properties.name: linkURL
properties.description: URL of the link that encloses the node the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: linkText
properties.description: Text associated with the link. May be an empty string if the contents of the link are an image.

properties.name: pageURL
properties.description: URL of the top level page that the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: frameURL
properties.description: URL of the subframe that the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: srcURL
properties.description: Source URL for the element that the context menu was invoked on. Elements with source URLs are images, audio and video.

properties.name: mediaType
properties.description: Type of the node the context menu was invoked on. Can be `none`, `image`, `audio`, `video`, `canvas`, `file` or `plugin`.

properties.name: hasImageContents
properties.description: Whether the context menu was invoked on an image which has non-empty contents.

properties.name: isEditable
properties.description: Whether the context is editable.

properties.name: selectionText
properties.description: Text of the selection that the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: titleText
properties.description: Title text of the selection that the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: altText
properties.description: Alt text of the selection that the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: suggestedFilename
properties.description: Suggested filename to be used when saving file through 'Save Link As' option of context menu.

properties.name: selectionRect
properties.description: Rect representing the coordinates in the document space of the selection.

properties.name: selectionStartOffset
properties.description: Start position of the selection text.

properties.name: referrerPolicy
properties.description: The referrer policy of the frame on which the menu is invoked.

properties.name: misspelledWord
properties.description: The misspelled word under the cursor, if any.

properties.name: dictionarySuggestions
properties.description: An array of suggested words to show the user to replace the `misspelledWord`.  Only available if there is a misspelled word and spellchecker is enabled.

properties.name: frameCharset
properties.description: The character encoding of the frame on which the menu was invoked.

properties.name: inputFieldType
properties.description: If the context menu was invoked on an input field, the type of that field. Possible values are `none`, `plainText`, `password`, `other`.

properties.name: spellcheckEnabled
properties.description: If the context is editable, whether or not spellchecking is enabled.

properties.name: menuSourceType
properties.description: Input source that invoked the context menu. Can be `none`, `mouse`, `keyboard`, `touch`, `touchMenu`, `longPress`, `longTap`, `touchHandle`, `stylus`, `adjustSelection`, or `adjustSelectionReset`.

properties.name: mediaFlags
properties.description: The flags for the media element the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: inError
properties.description: Whether the media element has crashed.

properties.name: isPaused
properties.description: Whether the media element is paused.

properties.name: isMuted
properties.description: Whether the media element is muted.

properties.name: hasAudio
properties.description: Whether the media element has audio.

properties.name: isLooping
properties.description: Whether the media element is looping.

properties.name: isControlsVisible
properties.description: Whether the media element's controls are visible.

properties.name: canToggleControls
properties.description: Whether the media element's controls are toggleable.

properties.name: canPrint
properties.description: Whether the media element can be printed.

properties.name: canSave
properties.description: Whether or not the media element can be downloaded.

properties.name: canShowPictureInPicture
properties.description: Whether the media element can show picture-in-picture.

properties.name: isShowingPictureInPicture
properties.description: Whether the media element is currently showing picture-in-picture.

properties.name: canRotate
properties.description: Whether the media element can be rotated.

properties.name: canLoop
properties.description: Whether the media element can be looped.

properties.name: editFlags
properties.description: These flags indicate whether the renderer believes it is able to perform the corresponding action.

properties.name: canUndo
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can undo.

properties.name: canRedo
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can redo.

properties.name: canCut
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can cut.

properties.name: canCopy
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can copy.

properties.name: canPaste
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can paste.

properties.name: canDelete
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can delete.

properties.name: canSelectAll
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can select all.

properties.name: canEditRichly
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can edit text richly.

instanceEvents.name: select-bluetooth-device
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when bluetooth device needs to be selected on call to `navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice`. To use `navigator.bluetooth` api `webBluetooth` should be enabled. If `event.preventDefault` is not called, first available device will be selected. `callback` should be called with `deviceId` to be selected, passing empty string to `callback` will cancel the request.

instanceEvents.name: paint
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a new frame is generated. Only the dirty area is passed in the buffer.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The image data of the whole frame.

instanceEvents.name: devtools-reload-page
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the devtools window instructs the webContents to reload

instanceEvents.name: will-attach-webview
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a `<webview>`'s web contents is being attached to this web contents. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will destroy the guest page.

This event can be used to configure `webPreferences` for the `webContents` of a `<webview>` before it's loaded, and provides the ability to set settings that can't be set via `<webview>` attributes.

**Note:** The specified `preload` script option will appear as `preloadURL` (not `preload`) in the `webPreferences` object emitted with this event.

parameters.name: webPreferences
parameters.description: The web preferences that will be used by the guest page. This object can be modified to adjust the preferences for the guest page.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The other `<webview>` parameters such as the `src` URL. This object can be modified to adjust the parameters of the guest page.

instanceEvents.name: did-attach-webview
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a `<webview>` has been attached to this web contents.

parameters.name: webContents
parameters.description: The guest web contents that is used by the `<webview>`.

instanceEvents.name: console-message
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the associated window logs a console message.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The log level, from 0 to 3. In order it matches `verbose`, `info`, `warning` and `error`.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The actual console message

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: The line number of the source that triggered this console message

instanceEvents.name: preload-error
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the preload script `preloadPath` throws an unhandled exception `error`.

instanceEvents.name: ipc-message
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the renderer process sends an asynchronous message via `ipcRenderer.send()`.

instanceEvents.name: ipc-message-sync
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the renderer process sends a synchronous message via `ipcRenderer.sendSync()`.

instanceEvents.name: desktop-capturer-get-sources
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `desktopCapturer.getSources()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will make it return empty sources.

instanceEvents.name: remote-require
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.require()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the module from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-global
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.getGlobal()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the global from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-builtin
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.getBuiltin()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the module from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-current-window
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.getCurrentWindow()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the object from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-current-web-contents
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.getCurrentWebContents()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the object from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: preferred-size-changed
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when the `WebContents` preferred size has changed.

This event will only be emitted when `enablePreferredSizeMode` is set to `true` in `webPreferences`.

parameters.name: preferredSize
parameters.description: The minimum size needed to contain the layout of the document—without requiring scrolling.

name: webFrameMain

methods.name: fromId
methods.description: A frame with the given process and routing IDs, or `undefined` if there is no WebFrameMain associated with the given IDs.

parameters.name: processId
parameters.description: An `Integer` representing the internal ID of the process which owns the frame.

parameters.name: routingId
parameters.description: An `Integer` representing the unique frame ID in the current renderer process. Routing IDs can be retrieved from `WebFrameMain` instances (`frame.routingId`) and are also passed by frame specific `WebContents` navigation events (e.g. `did-frame-navigate`).

instanceMethods.name: executeJavaScript
instanceMethods.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if execution throws or results in a rejected promise.

Evaluates `code` in page.

In the browser window some HTML APIs like `requestFullScreen` can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting `userGesture` to `true` will remove this limitation.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Default is `false`.

instanceMethods.name: reload
instanceMethods.description: Whether the reload was initiated successfully. Only results in `false` when the frame has no history.

instanceMethods.name: send
instanceMethods.description:
Send an asynchronous message to the renderer process via `channel`, along with arguments. Arguments will be serialized with the [Structured Clone Algorithm][SCA], just like [`postMessage`][], so prototype chains will not be included. Sending Functions, Promises, Symbols, WeakMaps, or WeakSets will throw an exception.

The renderer process can handle the message by listening to `channel` with the `ipcRenderer` module.

instanceMethods.name: postMessage
instanceMethods.description:
Send a message to the renderer process, optionally transferring ownership of zero or more [`MessagePortMain`][] objects.

The transferred `MessagePortMain` objects will be available in the renderer process by accessing the `ports` property of the emitted event. When they arrive in the renderer, they will be native DOM `MessagePort` objects.

For example:

instanceProperties.name: url
instanceProperties.description: A `string` representing the current URL of the frame.

instanceProperties.name: top
instanceProperties.description: A `WebFrameMain | null` representing top frame in the frame hierarchy to which `frame` belongs.

instanceProperties.name: parent
instanceProperties.description: A `WebFrameMain | null` representing parent frame of `frame`, the property would be `null` if `frame` is the top frame in the frame hierarchy.

instanceProperties.name: frames
instanceProperties.description: A `WebFrameMain[]` collection containing the direct descendents of `frame`.

instanceProperties.name: framesInSubtree
instanceProperties.description: A `WebFrameMain[]` collection containing every frame in the subtree of `frame`, including itself. This can be useful when traversing through all frames.

instanceProperties.name: frameTreeNodeId
instanceProperties.description: An `Integer` representing the id of the frame's internal FrameTreeNode instance. This id is browser-global and uniquely identifies a frame that hosts content. The identifier is fixed at the creation of the frame and stays constant for the lifetime of the frame. When the frame is removed, the id is not used again.

instanceProperties.name: name
instanceProperties.description: A `String` representing the frame name.

instanceProperties.name: osProcessId
instanceProperties.description: An `Integer` representing the operating system `pid` of the process which owns this frame.

instanceProperties.name: processId
instanceProperties.description: An `Integer` representing the Chromium internal `pid` of the process which owns this frame. This is not the same as the OS process ID; to read that use `frame.osProcessId`.

instanceProperties.name: routingId
instanceProperties.description: An `Integer` representing the unique frame id in the current renderer process. Distinct `WebFrameMain` instances that refer to the same underlying frame will have the same `routingId`.

name: webFrame
description:
> Customize the rendering of the current web page.

Process: Renderer

`webFrame` export of the Electron module is an instance of the `WebFrame` class representing the top frame of the current `BrowserWindow`. Sub-frames can be retrieved by certain properties and methods (e.g. `webFrame.firstChild`).

An example of zooming current page to 200%.

methods.name: setZoomFactor
methods.description:
Changes the zoom factor to the specified factor. Zoom factor is zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0.

The factor must be greater than 0.0.

parameters.name: factor
parameters.description: Zoom factor; default is 1.0.

methods.name: getZoomFactor
methods.description: The current zoom factor.

methods.name: setZoomLevel
methods.description:
Changes the zoom level to the specified level. The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively.

> **NOTE**: The zoom policy at the Chromium level is same-origin, meaning that the zoom level for a specific domain propagates across all instances of windows with the same domain. Differentiating the window URLs will make zoom work per-window.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Zoom level.

methods.name: getZoomLevel
methods.description: The current zoom level.

methods.name: setVisualZoomLevelLimits
methods.description:
Sets the maximum and minimum pinch-to-zoom level.

> **NOTE**: Visual zoom is disabled by default in Electron. To re-enable it, call:

> **NOTE**: Visual zoom only applies to pinch-to-zoom behavior. Cmd+/-/0 zoom shortcuts are controlled by the 'zoomIn', 'zoomOut', and 'resetZoom' MenuItem roles in the application Menu. To disable shortcuts, manually define the Menu and omit zoom roles from the definition.

methods.name: setSpellCheckProvider
methods.description:
Sets a provider for spell checking in input fields and text areas.

If you want to use this method you must disable the builtin spellchecker when you construct the window.

The `provider` must be an object that has a `spellCheck` method that accepts an array of individual words for spellchecking. The `spellCheck` function runs asynchronously and calls the `callback` function with an array of misspelt words when complete.

An example of using node-spellchecker as provider:

methods.name: insertCSS
methods.description:
A key for the inserted CSS that can later be used to remove the CSS via `webFrame.removeInsertedCSS(key)`.

Injects CSS into the current web page and returns a unique key for the inserted stylesheet.

parameters.name: css
parameters.description: CSS source code.

methods.name: removeInsertedCSS
methods.description: Removes the inserted CSS from the current web page. The stylesheet is identified by its key, which is returned from `webFrame.insertCSS(css)`.

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts `text` to the focused element.

methods.name: executeJavaScript
methods.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if execution throws or results in a rejected promise.

Evaluates `code` in page.

In the browser window some HTML APIs like `requestFullScreen` can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting `userGesture` to `true` will remove this limitation.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Default is `false`.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after script has been executed. Unless the frame is suspended (e.g. showing a modal alert), execution will be synchronous and the callback will be invoked before the method returns. For compatibility with an older version of this method, the error parameter is second.

methods.name: executeJavaScriptInIsolatedWorld
methods.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if execution could not start.

Works like `executeJavaScript` but evaluates `scripts` in an isolated context.

Note that when the execution of script fails, the returned promise will not reject and the `result` would be `undefined`. This is because Chromium does not dispatch errors of isolated worlds to foreign worlds.

parameters.name: worldId
parameters.description: The ID of the world to run the javascript in, `0` is the default main world (where content runs), `999` is the world used by Electron's `contextIsolation` feature. Accepts values in the range 1..536870911.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Default is `false`.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after script has been executed. Unless the frame is suspended (e.g. showing a modal alert), execution will be synchronous and the callback will be invoked before the method returns.  For compatibility with an older version of this method, the error parameter is second.

methods.name: setIsolatedWorldInfo
methods.description: Set the security origin, content security policy and name of the isolated world. Note: If the `csp` is specified, then the `securityOrigin` also has to be specified.

parameters.name: worldId
parameters.description: The ID of the world to run the javascript in, `0` is the default world, `999` is the world used by Electrons `contextIsolation` feature. Chrome extensions reserve the range of IDs in `[1 << 20, 1 << 29)`. You can provide any integer here.

properties.name: securityOrigin
properties.description: Security origin for the isolated world.

properties.name: csp
properties.description: Content Security Policy for the isolated world.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name for isolated world. Useful in devtools.

methods.name: getResourceUsage
methods.description:
* `images` MemoryUsageDetails
* `scripts` MemoryUsageDetails
* `cssStyleSheets` MemoryUsageDetails
* `xslStyleSheets` MemoryUsageDetails
* `fonts` MemoryUsageDetails
* `other` MemoryUsageDetails

Returns an object describing usage information of Blink's internal memory caches.

This will generate:

methods.name: clearCache
methods.description:
Attempts to free memory that is no longer being used (like images from a previous navigation).

Note that blindly calling this method probably makes Electron slower since it will have to refill these emptied caches, you should only call it if an event in your app has occurred that makes you think your page is actually using less memory (i.e. you have navigated from a super heavy page to a mostly empty one, and intend to stay there).

methods.name: getFrameForSelector
methods.description: The frame element in `webFrame's` document selected by `selector`, `null` would be returned if `selector` does not select a frame or if the frame is not in the current renderer process.

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: CSS selector for a frame element.

methods.name: findFrameByName
methods.description: A child of `webFrame` with the supplied `name`, `null` would be returned if there's no such frame or if the frame is not in the current renderer process.

methods.name: findFrameByRoutingId
methods.description: that has the supplied `routingId`, `null` if not found.

parameters.name: routingId
parameters.description: An `Integer` representing the unique frame id in the current renderer process. Routing IDs can be retrieved from `WebFrame` instances (`webFrame.routingId`) and are also passed by frame specific `WebContents` navigation events (e.g. `did-frame-navigate`)

methods.name: isWordMisspelled
methods.description: True if the word is misspelled according to the built in spellchecker, false otherwise. If no dictionary is loaded, always return false.

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: The word to be spellchecked.

methods.name: getWordSuggestions
methods.description: A list of suggested words for a given word. If the word is spelled correctly, the result will be empty.

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: The misspelled word.

properties.name: top
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing top frame in frame hierarchy to which `webFrame` belongs, the property would be `null` if top frame is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: opener
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing the frame which opened `webFrame`, the property would be `null` if there's no opener or opener is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing parent frame of `webFrame`, the property would be `null` if `webFrame` is top or parent is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: firstChild
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing the first child frame of `webFrame`, the property would be `null` if `webFrame` has no children or if first child is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: nextSibling
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing next sibling frame, the property would be `null` if `webFrame` is the last frame in its parent or if the next sibling is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: routingId
properties.description: An `Integer` representing the unique frame id in the current renderer process. Distinct WebFrame instances that refer to the same underlying frame will have the same `routingId`.

instanceMethods.name: onBeforeRequest
instanceMethods.description:
The `listener` will be called with `listener(details, callback)` when a request is about to occur.

The `uploadData` is an array of `UploadData` objects.

The `callback` has to be called with an `response` object.

Some examples of valid `urls`:

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: redirectURL
properties.description: The original request is prevented from being sent or completed and is instead redirected to the given URL.

instanceMethods.name: onBeforeSendHeaders
instanceMethods.description:
The `listener` will be called with `listener(details, callback)` before sending an HTTP request, once the request headers are available. This may occur after a TCP connection is made to the server, but before any http data is sent.

The `callback` has to be called with a `response` object.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: requestHeaders
properties.description: When provided, request will be made with these headers.

instanceMethods.name: onSendHeaders
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` just before a request is going to be sent to the server, modifications of previous `onBeforeSendHeaders` response are visible by the time this listener is fired.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

instanceMethods.name: onHeadersReceived
instanceMethods.description:
The `listener` will be called with `listener(details, callback)` when HTTP response headers of a request have been received.

The `callback` has to be called with a `response` object.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: responseHeaders
properties.description: When provided, the server is assumed to have responded with these headers.

properties.name: statusLine
properties.description: Should be provided when overriding `responseHeaders` to change header status otherwise original response header's status will be used.

instanceMethods.name: onResponseStarted
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` when first byte of the response body is received. For HTTP requests, this means that the status line and response headers are available.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: fromCache
properties.description: Indicates whether the response was fetched from disk cache.

instanceMethods.name: onBeforeRedirect
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` when a server initiated redirect is about to occur.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: ip
properties.description: The server IP address that the request was actually sent to.

instanceMethods.name: onCompleted
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` when a request is completed.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

instanceMethods.name: onErrorOccurred
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` when an error occurs.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: error
properties.description: The error description.

name: webviewTag
description:
### Warning

Electron's `webview` tag is based on Chromium's `webview`, which is undergoing dramatic architectural changes. This impacts the stability of `webviews`, including rendering, navigation, and event routing. We currently recommend to not use the `webview` tag and to consider alternatives, like `iframe`, Electron's `BrowserView`, or an architecture that avoids embedded content altogether.

### Enabling

By default the `webview` tag is disabled in Electron >= 5.  You need to enable the tag by setting the `webviewTag` webPreferences option when constructing your `BrowserWindow`. For more information see the BrowserWindow constructor docs.

### Overview

> Display external web content in an isolated frame and process.

Process: Renderer

Use the `webview` tag to embed 'guest' content (such as web pages) in your Electron app. The guest content is contained within the `webview` container. An embedded page within your app controls how the guest content is laid out and rendered.

Unlike an `iframe`, the `webview` runs in a separate process than your app. It doesn't have the same permissions as your web page and all interactions between your app and embedded content will be asynchronous. This keeps your app safe from the embedded content. **Note:** Most methods called on the webview from the host page require a synchronous call to the main process.

### Example

To embed a web page in your app, add the `webview` tag to your app's embedder page (this is the app page that will display the guest content). In its simplest form, the `webview` tag includes the `src` of the web page and css styles that control the appearance of the `webview` container:

```
<webview id="foo" src="https://www.github.com/" style="display:inline-flex; width:640px; height:480px"></webview>
```

If you want to control the guest content in any way, you can write JavaScript that listens for `webview` events and responds to those events using the `webview` methods. Here's sample code with two event listeners: one that listens for the web page to start loading, the other for the web page to stop loading, and displays a "loading..." message during the load time:

```
<script>
  onload = () => {
    const webview = document.querySelector('webview')
    const indicator = document.querySelector('.indicator')

    const loadstart = () => {
      indicator.innerText = 'loading...'
    }

    const loadstop = () => {
      indicator.innerText = ''
    }

    webview.addEventListener('did-start-loading', loadstart)
    webview.addEventListener('did-stop-loading', loadstop)
  }
</script>
```

### Internal implementation

Under the hood `webview` is implemented with Out-of-Process iframes (OOPIFs). The `webview` tag is essentially a custom element using shadow DOM to wrap an `iframe` element inside it.

So the behavior of `webview` is very similar to a cross-domain `iframe`, as examples:

* When clicking into a `webview`, the page focus will move from the embedder frame to `webview`.
* You can not add keyboard, mouse, and scroll event listeners to `webview`.
* All reactions between the embedder frame and `webview` are asynchronous.

### CSS Styling Notes

Please note that the `webview` tag's style uses `display:flex;` internally to ensure the child `iframe` element fills the full height and width of its `webview` container when used with traditional and flexbox layouts. Please do not overwrite the default `display:flex;` CSS property, unless specifying `display:inline-flex;` for inline layout.

### Tag Attributes

The `webview` tag has the following attributes:

### `src`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/"></webview>
```

A `String` representing the visible URL. Writing to this attribute initiates top-level navigation.

Assigning `src` its own value will reload the current page.

The `src` attribute can also accept data URLs, such as `data:text/plain,Hello, world!`.

### `nodeintegration`

```
<webview src="http://www.google.com/" nodeintegration></webview>
```

A `Boolean`. When this attribute is present the guest page in `webview` will have node integration and can use node APIs like `require` and `process` to access low level system resources. Node integration is disabled by default in the guest page.

### `nodeintegrationinsubframes`

```
<webview src="http://www.google.com/" nodeintegrationinsubframes></webview>
```

A `Boolean` for the experimental option for enabling NodeJS support in sub-frames such as iframes inside the `webview`. All your preloads will load for every iframe, you can use `process.isMainFrame` to determine if you are in the main frame or not. This option is disabled by default in the guest page.

### `enableremotemodule`

```
<webview src="http://www.google.com/" enableremotemodule="false"></webview>
```

A `Boolean`. When this attribute is `false` the guest page in `webview` will not have access to the `remote` module. The remote module is unavailable by default.

### `plugins`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/" plugins></webview>
```

A `Boolean`. When this attribute is present the guest page in `webview` will be able to use browser plugins. Plugins are disabled by default.

### `preload`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/" preload="./test.js"></webview>
```

A `String` that specifies a script that will be loaded before other scripts run in the guest page. The protocol of script's URL must be either `file:` or `asar:`, because it will be loaded by `require` in guest page under the hood.

When the guest page doesn't have node integration this script will still have access to all Node APIs, but global objects injected by Node will be deleted after this script has finished executing.

**Note:** This option will appear as `preloadURL` (not `preload`) in the `webPreferences` specified to the `will-attach-webview` event.

### `httpreferrer`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/" httpreferrer="http://cheng.guru"></webview>
```

A `String` that sets the referrer URL for the guest page.

### `useragent`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/" useragent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/7.0; AS; rv:11.0) like Gecko"></webview>
```

A `String` that sets the user agent for the guest page before the page is navigated to. Once the page is loaded, use the `setUserAgent` method to change the user agent.

### `disablewebsecurity`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/" disablewebsecurity></webview>
```

A `Boolean`. When this attribute is present the guest page will have web security disabled. Web security is enabled by default.

### `partition`

```
<webview src="https://github.com" partition="persist:github"></webview>
<webview src="https://electronjs.org" partition="electron"></webview>
```

A `String` that sets the session used by the page. If `partition` starts with `persist:`, the page will use a persistent session available to all pages in the app with the same `partition`. if there is no `persist:` prefix, the page will use an in-memory session. By assigning the same `partition`, multiple pages can share the same session. If the `partition` is unset then default session of the app will be used.

This value can only be modified before the first navigation, since the session of an active renderer process cannot change. Subsequent attempts to modify the value will fail with a DOM exception.

### `allowpopups`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/" allowpopups></webview>
```

A `Boolean`. When this attribute is present the guest page will be allowed to open new windows. Popups are disabled by default.

### `webpreferences`

```
<webview src="https://github.com" webpreferences="allowRunningInsecureContent, javascript=no"></webview>
```

A `String` which is a comma separated list of strings which specifies the web preferences to be set on the webview. The full list of supported preference strings can be found in BrowserWindow.

The string follows the same format as the features string in `window.open`. A name by itself is given a `true` boolean value. A preference can be set to another value by including an `=`, followed by the value. Special values `yes` and `1` are interpreted as `true`, while `no` and `0` are interpreted as `false`.

### `enableblinkfeatures`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/" enableblinkfeatures="PreciseMemoryInfo, CSSVariables"></webview>
```

A `String` which is a list of strings which specifies the blink features to be enabled separated by `,`. The full list of supported feature strings can be found in the RuntimeEnabledFeatures.json5 file.

### `disableblinkfeatures`

```
<webview src="https://www.github.com/" disableblinkfeatures="PreciseMemoryInfo, CSSVariables"></webview>
```

A `String` which is a list of strings which specifies the blink features to be disabled separated by `,`. The full list of supported feature strings can be found in the RuntimeEnabledFeatures.json5 file.

methods.name: loadURL
methods.description:
The promise will resolve when the page has finished loading (see `did-finish-load`), and rejects if the page fails to load (see `did-fail-load`).

Loads the `url` in the webview, the `url` must contain the protocol prefix, e.g. the `http://` or `file://`.

properties.name: httpReferrer
properties.description: An HTTP Referrer url.

properties.name: userAgent
properties.description: A user agent originating the request.

properties.name: extraHeaders
properties.description: Extra headers separated by "\n"

properties.name: baseURLForDataURL
properties.description: Base url (with trailing path separator) for files to be loaded by the data url. This is needed only if the specified `url` is a data url and needs to load other files.

methods.name: downloadURL
methods.description: Initiates a download of the resource at `url` without navigating.

methods.name: getURL
methods.description: The URL of guest page.

methods.name: getTitle
methods.description: The title of guest page.

methods.name: isLoading
methods.description: Whether guest page is still loading resources.

methods.name: isLoadingMainFrame
methods.description: Whether the main frame (and not just iframes or frames within it) is still loading.

methods.name: isWaitingForResponse
methods.description: Whether the guest page is waiting for a first-response for the main resource of the page.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops any pending navigation.

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reloads the guest page.

methods.name: reloadIgnoringCache
methods.description: Reloads the guest page and ignores cache.

methods.name: canGoBack
methods.description: Whether the guest page can go back.

methods.name: canGoForward
methods.description: Whether the guest page can go forward.

methods.name: canGoToOffset
methods.description: Whether the guest page can go to `offset`.

methods.name: clearHistory
methods.description: Clears the navigation history.

methods.name: goBack
methods.description: Makes the guest page go back.

methods.name: goForward
methods.description: Makes the guest page go forward.

methods.name: goToIndex
methods.description: Navigates to the specified absolute index.

methods.name: goToOffset
methods.description: Navigates to the specified offset from the "current entry".

methods.name: isCrashed
methods.description: Whether the renderer process has crashed.

methods.name: setUserAgent
methods.description: Overrides the user agent for the guest page.

methods.name: getUserAgent
methods.description: The user agent for guest page.

methods.name: insertCSS
methods.description:
A promise that resolves with a key for the inserted CSS that can later be used to remove the CSS via `<webview>.removeInsertedCSS(key)`.

Injects CSS into the current web page and returns a unique key for the inserted stylesheet.

methods.name: removeInsertedCSS
methods.description:
Resolves if the removal was successful.

Removes the inserted CSS from the current web page. The stylesheet is identified by its key, which is returned from `<webview>.insertCSS(css)`.

methods.name: executeJavaScript
methods.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if the result of the code is a rejected promise.

Evaluates `code` in page. If `userGesture` is set, it will create the user gesture context in the page. HTML APIs like `requestFullScreen`, which require user action, can take advantage of this option for automation.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Default `false`.

methods.name: openDevTools
methods.description: Opens a DevTools window for guest page.

methods.name: closeDevTools
methods.description: Closes the DevTools window of guest page.

methods.name: isDevToolsOpened
methods.description: Whether guest page has a DevTools window attached.

methods.name: isDevToolsFocused
methods.description: Whether DevTools window of guest page is focused.

methods.name: inspectElement
methods.description: Starts inspecting element at position (`x`, `y`) of guest page.

methods.name: inspectSharedWorker
methods.description: Opens the DevTools for the shared worker context present in the guest page.

methods.name: inspectServiceWorker
methods.description: Opens the DevTools for the service worker context present in the guest page.

methods.name: setAudioMuted
methods.description: Set guest page muted.

methods.name: isAudioMuted
methods.description: Whether guest page has been muted.

methods.name: isCurrentlyAudible
methods.description: Whether audio is currently playing.

methods.name: undo
methods.description: Executes editing command `undo` in page.

methods.name: redo
methods.description: Executes editing command `redo` in page.

methods.name: cut
methods.description: Executes editing command `cut` in page.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Executes editing command `copy` in page.

methods.name: paste
methods.description: Executes editing command `paste` in page.

methods.name: pasteAndMatchStyle
methods.description: Executes editing command `pasteAndMatchStyle` in page.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Executes editing command `delete` in page.

methods.name: selectAll
methods.description: Executes editing command `selectAll` in page.

methods.name: unselect
methods.description: Executes editing command `unselect` in page.

methods.name: replace
methods.description: Executes editing command `replace` in page.

methods.name: replaceMisspelling
methods.description: Executes editing command `replaceMisspelling` in page.

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts `text` to the focused element.

methods.name: findInPage
methods.description:
The request id used for the request.

Starts a request to find all matches for the `text` in the web page. The result of the request can be obtained by subscribing to `found-in-page` event.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Content to be searched, must not be empty.

properties.name: forward
properties.description: Whether to search forward or backward, defaults to `true`.

properties.name: findNext
properties.description: Whether to begin a new text finding session with this request. Should be `true` for initial requests, and `false` for follow-up requests. Defaults to `false`.

properties.name: matchCase
properties.description: Whether search should be case-sensitive, defaults to `false`.

methods.name: stopFindInPage
methods.description: Stops any `findInPage` request for the `webview` with the provided `action`.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Specifies the action to take place when ending `<webview>.findInPage` request.

possibleValues.description: Clear the selection.
Translate the selection into a normal selection.
Focus and click the selection node.

methods.name: print
methods.description: Prints `webview`'s web page. Same as `webContents.print([options])`.

properties.name: silent
properties.description: Don't ask user for print settings. Default is `false`.

properties.name: printBackground
properties.description: Prints the background color and image of the web page. Default is `false`.

properties.name: deviceName
properties.description: Set the printer device name to use. Must be the system-defined name and not the 'friendly' name, e.g 'Brother_QL_820NWB' and not 'Brother QL-820NWB'.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Set whether the printed web page will be in color or grayscale. Default is `true`.

properties.name: marginType
properties.description: Can be `default`, `none`, `printableArea`, or `custom`. If `custom` is chosen, you will also need to specify `top`, `bottom`, `left`, and `right`.

properties.name: top
properties.description: The top margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: The bottom margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: left
properties.description: The left margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: right
properties.description: The right margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: landscape
properties.description: Whether the web page should be printed in landscape mode. Default is `false`.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: The scale factor of the web page.

properties.name: pagesPerSheet
properties.description: The number of pages to print per page sheet.

properties.name: collate
properties.description: Whether the web page should be collated.

properties.name: copies
properties.description: The number of copies of the web page to print.

properties.name: pageRanges
properties.description: The page range to print.

properties.name: from
properties.description: Index of the first page to print (0-based).

properties.name: to
properties.description: Index of the last page to print (inclusive) (0-based).

properties.name: duplexMode
properties.description: Set the duplex mode of the printed web page. Can be `simplex`, `shortEdge`, or `longEdge`.

properties.name: header
properties.description: String to be printed as page header.

properties.name: footer
properties.description: String to be printed as page footer.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: Specify page size of the printed document. Can be `A3`, `A4`, `A5`, `Legal`, `Letter`, `Tabloid` or an Object containing `height`.

methods.name: printToPDF
methods.description:
Resolves with the generated PDF data.

Prints `webview`'s web page as PDF, Same as `webContents.printToPDF(options)`.

properties.name: headerFooter
properties.description: the header and footer for the PDF.

properties.name: landscape
properties.description: `true` for landscape, `false` for portrait.

properties.name: marginsType
properties.description: Specifies the type of margins to use. Uses 0 for default margin, 1 for no margin, and 2 for minimum margin. and `width` in microns.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: The scale factor of the web page. Can range from 0 to 100.

properties.name: pageRanges
properties.description: The page range to print. On macOS, only the first range is honored.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: Specify page size of the generated PDF. Can be `A3`, `A4`, `A5`, `Legal`, `Letter`, `Tabloid` or an Object containing `height`

properties.name: printBackground
properties.description: Whether to print CSS backgrounds.

properties.name: printSelectionOnly
properties.description: Whether to print selection only.

methods.name: capturePage
methods.description:
Resolves with a NativeImage

Captures a snapshot of the page within `rect`. Omitting `rect` will capture the whole visible page.

parameters.name: rect
parameters.description: The area of the page to be captured.

methods.name: send
methods.description:
Send an asynchronous message to renderer process via `channel`, you can also send arbitrary arguments. The renderer process can handle the message by listening to the `channel` event with the `ipcRenderer` module.

See webContents.send for examples.

methods.name: sendInputEvent
methods.description:
Sends an input `event` to the page.

See webContents.sendInputEvent for detailed description of `event` object.

methods.name: setZoomFactor
methods.description: Changes the zoom factor to the specified factor. Zoom factor is zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0.

parameters.name: factor
parameters.description: Zoom factor.

methods.name: setZoomLevel
methods.description:
Changes the zoom level to the specified level. The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively. The formula for this is `scale := 1.2 ^ level`.

> **NOTE**: The zoom policy at the Chromium level is same-origin, meaning that the zoom level for a specific domain propagates across all instances of windows with the same domain. Differentiating the window URLs will make zoom work per-window.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Zoom level.

methods.name: getZoomFactor
methods.description: the current zoom factor.

methods.name: getZoomLevel
methods.description: the current zoom level.

methods.name: setVisualZoomLevelLimits
methods.description: Sets the maximum and minimum pinch-to-zoom level.

methods.name: showDefinitionForSelection
methods.description: Shows pop-up dictionary that searches the selected word on the page.

methods.name: getWebContentsId
methods.description: The WebContents ID of this `webview`.

events.description: This event is like `did-finish-load`, but fired when the load failed or was cancelled, e.g. `window.stop()` is invoked.

events.name: did-frame-finish-load
events.description: Fired when a frame has done navigation.

events.name: did-start-loading
events.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab starts spinning.

events.name: did-stop-loading
events.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab stops spinning.

events.name: dom-ready
events.description: Fired when document in the given frame is loaded.

events.name: page-title-updated
events.description: Fired when page title is set during navigation. `explicitSet` is false when title is synthesized from file url.

events.name: page-favicon-updated
events.description: Fired when page receives favicon urls.

parameters.name: favicons
parameters.description: Array of URLs.

events.name: enter-html-full-screen
events.description: Fired when page enters fullscreen triggered by HTML API.

events.name: leave-html-full-screen
events.description: Fired when page leaves fullscreen triggered by HTML API.

events.name: console-message
events.description:
Fired when the guest window logs a console message.

The following example code forwards all log messages to the embedder's console without regard for log level or other properties.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The log level, from 0 to 3. In order it matches `verbose`, `info`, `warning` and `error`.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The actual console message

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: The line number of the source that triggered this console message

events.name: found-in-page
events.description: Fired when a result is available for `webview.findInPage` request.

properties.name: activeMatchOrdinal
properties.description: Position of the active match.

properties.name: matches
properties.description: Number of Matches.

properties.name: selectionArea
properties.description: Coordinates of first match region.

events.name: new-window
events.description:
Fired when the guest page attempts to open a new browser window.

The following example code opens the new url in system's default browser.

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: Can be `default`, `foreground-tab`, `background-tab`, `new-window`, `save-to-disk` and `other`.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The options which should be used for creating the new `BrowserWindow`.

events.name: will-navigate
events.description:
Emitted when a user or the page wants to start navigation. It can happen when the `window.location` object is changed or a user clicks a link in the page.

This event will not emit when the navigation is started programmatically with APIs like `<webview>.loadURL` and `<webview>.back`.

It is also not emitted during in-page navigation, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` does __NOT__ have any effect.

events.name: did-navigate
events.description:
Emitted when a navigation is done.

This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

events.name: did-navigate-in-page
events.description:
Emitted when an in-page navigation happened.

When in-page navigation happens, the page URL changes but does not cause navigation outside of the page. Examples of this occurring are when anchor links are clicked or when the DOM `hashchange` event is triggered.

events.name: close
events.description:
Fired when the guest page attempts to close itself.

The following example code navigates the `webview` to `about:blank` when the guest attempts to close itself.

events.name: ipc-message
events.description:
Fired when the guest page has sent an asynchronous message to embedder page.

With `sendToHost` method and `ipc-message` event you can communicate between guest page and embedder page:

events.name: crashed
events.description: Fired when the renderer process is crashed.

events.name: plugin-crashed
events.description: Fired when a plugin process is crashed.

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Fired when the WebContents is destroyed.

events.name: media-started-playing
events.description: Emitted when media starts playing.

events.name: media-paused
events.description: Emitted when media is paused or done playing.

events.name: did-change-theme-color
events.description: Emitted when a page's theme color changes. This is usually due to encountering a meta tag:

events.name: update-target-url
events.description: Emitted when mouse moves over a link or the keyboard moves the focus to a link.

events.name: devtools-opened
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is opened.

events.name: devtools-closed
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is closed.

events.name: devtools-focused
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is focused / opened.

properties.description: The Same Site policy applied to this cookie.  Can be `unspecified`, `no_restriction`, `lax` or `strict`.

properties.description: Percentage of CPU used since the last call to getCPUUsage. First call returns 0.

properties.name: idleWakeupsPerSecond
properties.description: The number of average idle CPU wakeups per second since the last call to getCPUUsage. First call returns 0. Will always return 0 on Windows.

properties.description: Custom schemes to be registered with options.

properties.description: Default false.

properties.name: secure
properties.description: Default false.

properties.name: bypassCSP
properties.description: Default false.

properties.name: allowServiceWorkers
properties.description: Default false.

properties.name: supportFetchAPI
properties.description: Default false.

properties.name: corsEnabled
properties.description: Default false.

properties.name: stream
properties.description: Default false.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier of a window or screen that can be used as a `chromeMediaSourceId` constraint when calling [`navigator.webkitGetUserMedia`]. The format of the identifier will be `window:XX:YY` or `screen:ZZ:0`. XX is the windowID/handle. YY is 1 for the current process, and 0 for all others. ZZ is a sequential number that represents the screen, and it does not equal to the index in the source's name.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A screen source will be named either `Entire Screen` or `Screen <index>`, while the name of a window source will match the window title.

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: A thumbnail image. **Note:** There is no guarantee that the size of the thumbnail is the same as the `thumbnailSize` specified in the `options` passed to `desktopCapturer.getSources`. The actual size depends on the scale of the screen or window.

properties.name: display_id
properties.description: A unique identifier that will correspond to the `id` of the matching Display returned by the Screen API. On some platforms, this is equivalent to the `XX` portion of the `id` field above and on others it will differ. It will be an empty string if not available.

properties.name: appIcon
properties.description: An icon image of the application that owns the window or null if the source has a type screen. The size of the icon is not known in advance and depends on what the application provides.

name: Display
description: The `Display` object represents a physical display connected to the system. A fake `Display` may exist on a headless system, or a `Display` may correspond to a remote, virtual display.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier associated with the display.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: Can be 0, 90, 180, 270, represents screen rotation in clock-wise degrees.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: Output device's pixel scale factor.

properties.name: touchSupport
properties.description: Can be `available`, `unavailable`, `unknown`.

properties.name: monochrome
properties.description: Whether or not the display is a monochrome display.

properties.name: accelerometerSupport
properties.description: Can be `available`, `unavailable`, `unknown`.

properties.name: colorSpace
properties.description: represent a color space (three-dimensional object which contains all realizable color combinations) for the purpose of color conversions

properties.name: colorDepth
properties.description: The number of bits per pixel.

properties.name: depthPerComponent
properties.description: The number of bits per color component.

properties.name: displayFrequency
properties.description: The display refresh rate.

properties.name: bounds
properties.description: the bounds of the display in DIP points.

properties.name: workArea
properties.description: the work area of the display in DIP points.

properties.name: internal
properties.description: `true` for an internal display and `false` for an external display

properties.name: manifest
properties.description: Copy of the extension's manifest data.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The extension's file path.

properties.name: url
properties.description: The extension's `chrome-extension://` URL.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The path to the file to send.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: Additional headers to be sent.

name: GPUFeatureStatus
description:
Possible values:

* `disabled_software` - Software only. Hardware acceleration disabled (yellow)
* `disabled_off` - Disabled (red)
* `disabled_off_ok` - Disabled (yellow)
* `unavailable_software` - Software only, hardware acceleration unavailable (yellow)
* `unavailable_off` - Unavailable (red)
* `unavailable_off_ok` - Unavailable (yellow)
* `enabled_readback` - Hardware accelerated but at reduced performance (yellow)
* `enabled_force` - Hardware accelerated on all pages (green)
* `enabled` - Hardware accelerated (green)
* `enabled_on` - Enabled (green)
* `enabled_force_on` - Force enabled (green)

properties.name: reply
properties.description: A function that will send an IPC message to the renderer frame that sent the original message that you are currently handling.  You should use this method to "reply" to the sent message in order to guarantee the reply will go to the correct process and frame.

properties.name: processId
properties.description: The internal ID of the renderer process that sent this message

properties.name: sender
properties.description: Returns the `webContents` that sent the message

This only applies to messages sent from a different renderer. Messages sent directly from the main process set `event.senderId` to `0`.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: A list of MessagePorts that were transferred with this message

name: JumpListCategory
description:
**Note:** If a `JumpListCategory` object has neither the `type` nor the `name` property set then its `type` is assumed to be `tasks`. If the `name` property is set but the `type` property is omitted then the `type` is assumed to be `custom`.

**Note:** The maximum length of a Jump List item's `description` property is 260 characters. Beyond this limit, the item will not be added to the Jump List, nor will it be displayed.

properties.name: type
properties.description: One of the following:

possibleValues.description: Items in this category will be placed into the standard `Tasks` category. There can be only one such category, and it will always be displayed at the bottom of the Jump List.
Displays a list of files frequently opened by the app, the name of the category and its items are set by Windows.
Displays a list of files recently opened by the app, the name of the category and its items are set by Windows. Items may be added to this category indirectly using `app.addRecentDocument(path)`.
Displays tasks or file links, `name` must be set by the app.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Must be set if `type` is `custom`, otherwise it should be omitted.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Array of `JumpListItem` objects if `type` is `tasks` or `custom`, otherwise it should be omitted.

properties.name: type
properties.description: One of the following:

possibleValues.description: A task will launch an app with specific arguments.
Can be used to separate items in the standard `Tasks` category.
A file link will open a file using the app that created the Jump List, for this to work the app must be registered as a handler for the file type (though it doesn't have to be the default handler).

properties.name: path
properties.description: Path of the file to open, should only be set if `type` is `file`.

properties.name: program
properties.description: Path of the program to execute, usually you should specify `process.execPath` which opens the current program. Should only be set if `type` is `task`.

properties.name: args
properties.description: The command line arguments when `program` is executed. Should only be set if `type` is `task`.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The text to be displayed for the item in the Jump List. Should only be set if `type` is `task`.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the task (displayed in a tooltip). Should only be set if `type` is `task`. Maximum length 260 characters.

properties.name: iconPath
properties.description: The absolute path to an icon to be displayed in a Jump List, which can be an arbitrary resource file that contains an icon (e.g. `.ico`, `.exe`, `.dll`). You can usually specify `process.execPath` to show the program icon.

properties.name: iconIndex
properties.description: The index of the icon in the resource file. If a resource file contains multiple icons this value can be used to specify the zero-based index of the icon that should be displayed for this task. If a resource file contains only one icon, this property should be set to zero.

properties.name: workingDirectory
properties.description: The working directory. Default is empty.

properties.name: ctrlKey
properties.description: whether the Control key was used in an accelerator to trigger the Event

properties.name: metaKey
properties.description: whether a meta key was used in an accelerator to trigger the Event

properties.name: shiftKey
properties.description: whether a Shift key was used in an accelerator to trigger the Event

properties.name: altKey
properties.description: whether an Alt key was used in an accelerator to trigger the Event

properties.name: triggeredByAccelerator
properties.description: whether an accelerator was used to trigger the event as opposed to another user gesture like mouse click

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the event, can be `keyDown`, `keyUp` or `char`.

properties.name: keyCode
properties.description: The character that will be sent as the keyboard event. Should only use the valid key codes in Accelerator.

name: MemoryInfo
description: Note that all statistics are reported in Kilobytes.

properties.name: privateBytes

properties.name: data

properties.name: button

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the event, can be `mouseWheel`.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of action, can be `button`.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The label for the given action.

properties.name: actionIdentifier

properties.name: date

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: The unique identifier for this notification request.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.description: A dictionary of custom information associated with the notification.

properties.name: userText
properties.description: The text entered or chosen by the user.

name: Point
description: **Note:** Both `x` and `y` must be whole integers, when providing a point object as input to an Electron API we will automatically round your `x` and `y` values to the nearest whole integer.

name: PostBody
description: Note that keys starting with `--` are not currently supported. For example, this will errantly submit as `multipart/form-data` when `nativeWindowOpen` is set to `false` in webPreferences:

properties.name: data
properties.description: The post data to be sent to the new window.

properties.name: contentType
properties.description: The `content-type` header used for the data. One of `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` or `multipart/form-data`. Corresponds to the `enctype` attribute of the submitted HTML form.

properties.name: boundary
properties.description: The boundary used to separate multiple parts of the message. Only valid when `contentType` is `multipart/form-data`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: the name of the printer as understood by the OS.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: the name of the printer as shown in Print Preview.

properties.name: description
properties.description: a longer description of the printer's type.

properties.name: status
properties.description: the current status of the printer.

properties.name: isDefault
properties.description: whether or not a given printer is set as the default printer on the OS.

properties.name: options
properties.description: an object containing a variable number of platform-specific printer information.

properties.name: residentSet
properties.description: The amount of memory currently pinned to actual physical RAM in Kilobytes.

properties.name: private
properties.description: The amount of memory not shared by other processes, such as JS heap or HTML content in Kilobytes.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: The amount of memory shared between processes, typically memory consumed by the Electron code itself in Kilobytes.

properties.name: pid
properties.description: Process id of the process.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Process type. One of the following values:

properties.name: serviceName
properties.description: The non-localized name of the process.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the process. Examples for utility: `Audio Service`, `Content Decryption Module Service`, `Network Service`, `Video Capture`, etc.

properties.name: cpu
properties.description: CPU usage of the process.

properties.name: creationTime
properties.description: Creation time for this process. The time is represented as number of milliseconds since epoch. Since the `pid` can be reused after a process dies, it is useful to use both the `pid` and the `creationTime` to uniquely identify a process.

properties.name: memory
properties.description: Memory information for the process.

properties.name: sandboxed
properties.description: Whether the process is sandboxed on OS level.

properties.name: integrityLevel
properties.description: One of the following values:

properties.name: productIdentifier
properties.description: The string that identifies the product to the Apple App Store.

properties.name: localizedDescription
properties.description: A description of the product.

properties.name: localizedTitle
properties.description: The name of the product.

properties.name: contentVersion
properties.description: A string that identifies the version of the content.

properties.name: contentLengths
properties.description: The total size of the content, in bytes.

properties.name: price
properties.description: The cost of the product in the local currency.

properties.name: formattedPrice
properties.description: The locale formatted price of the product.

properties.name: currencyCode
properties.description: 3 character code presenting a product's currency based on the ISO 4217 standard.

properties.name: isDownloadable
properties.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the App Store has downloadable content for this product. `true` if at least one file has been associated with the product.

properties.name: contentType
properties.description: MIME type of the content.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Content to be sent.

properties.name: error
properties.description: When assigned, the `request` will fail with the `error` number . For the available error numbers you can use, please see the net error list.

properties.name: statusCode
properties.description: The HTTP response code, default is 200.

properties.name: charset
properties.description: The charset of response body, default is `"utf-8"`.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: The MIME type of response body, default is `"text/html"`. Setting `mimeType` would implicitly set the `content-type` header in response, but if `content-type` is already set in `headers`, the `mimeType` would be ignored.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: An object containing the response headers. The keys must be String, and values must be either String or Array of String.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The response body. When returning stream as response, this is a Node.js readable stream representing the response body. When returning `Buffer` as response, this is a `Buffer`. When returning `String` as response, this is a `String`. This is ignored for other types of responses.

properties.name: path
properties.description: Path to the file which would be sent as response body. This is only used for file responses.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Download the `url` and pipe the result as response body. This is only used for URL responses.

properties.name: referrer
properties.description: The `referrer` URL. This is only used for file and URL responses.

properties.name: method
properties.description: The HTTP `method`. This is only used for file and URL responses.

properties.name: session
properties.description: The session used for requesting URL, by default the HTTP request will reuse the current session. Setting `session` to `null` would use a random independent session. This is only used for URL responses.

properties.name: uploadData
properties.description: The data used as upload data. This is only used for URL responses when `method` is `"POST"`.

properties.name: x
properties.description: The x coordinate of the origin of the rectangle (must be an integer).

properties.name: y
properties.description: The y coordinate of the origin of the rectangle (must be an integer).

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the rectangle (must be an integer).

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the rectangle (must be an integer).

properties.name: url
properties.description: HTTP Referrer URL.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: Can be `default`, `unsafe-url`, `no-referrer-when-downgrade`, `no-referrer`, `origin`, `strict-origin-when-cross-origin`, `same-origin` or `strict-origin`. See the Referrer-Policy spec for more details on the meaning of these values.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The text to appear in this item.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The image to appear in this item.

properties.name: label

properties.name: enabled

properties.name: portId

properties.name: displayName

properties.name: vendorId

properties.name: productId

properties.name: serialNumber

properties.name: usbDriverName

properties.name: deviceInstanceId

properties.name: scriptUrl
properties.description: The full URL to the script that this service worker runs

properties.name: scope

properties.name: renderProcessId
properties.description: The virtual ID of the process that this service worker is running in.  This is not an OS level PID.  This aligns with the ID set used for `webContents.getProcessId()`.

properties.name: id

properties.name: url

properties.name: texts
