properties.name: filePaths
properties.description: An array of files to share.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: An array of URLs to share.

properties.name: target
properties.description: The target to launch from this shortcut.

properties.name: cwd
properties.description: The working directory. Default is empty.

properties.name: args
properties.description: The arguments to be applied to `target` when launching from this shortcut. Default is empty.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the shortcut. Default is empty.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The path to the icon, can be a DLL or EXE. `icon` and `iconIndex` have to be set together. Default is empty, which uses the target's icon.

properties.name: iconIndex
properties.description: The resource ID of icon when `icon` is a DLL or EXE. Default is 0.

properties.name: appUserModelId
properties.description: The Application User Model ID. Default is empty.

properties.name: toastActivatorClsid
properties.description: The Application Toast Activator CLSID. Needed for participating in Action Center.

properties.name: program
properties.description: Path of the program to execute, usually you should specify `process.execPath` which opens the current program.

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The command line arguments when `program` is executed.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The string to be displayed in a JumpList.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of this task.

properties.name: iconPath
properties.description: The absolute path to an icon to be displayed in a JumpList, which can be an arbitrary resource file that contains an icon. You can usually specify `process.execPath` to show the icon of the program.

properties.name: iconIndex
properties.description: The icon index in the icon file. If an icon file consists of two or more icons, set this value to identify the icon. If an icon file consists of one icon, this value is 0.

properties.name: workingDirectory
properties.description: The working directory. Default is empty.

name: ThumbarButton
description:
The `flags` is an array that can include following `String`s:

* `enabled` - The button is active and available to the user.
* `disabled` - The button is disabled. It is present, but has a visual state indicating it will not respond to user action.
* `dismissonclick` - When the button is clicked, the thumbnail window closes immediately.
* `nobackground` - Do not draw a button border, use only the image.
* `hidden` - The button is not shown to the user.
* `noninteractive` - The button is enabled but not interactive; no pressed button state is drawn. This value is intended for instances where the button is used in a notification.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The icon showing in thumbnail toolbar.

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: The text of the button's tooltip.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Control specific states and behaviors of the button. By default, it is `['enabled']`.

properties.name: categoryFilter
properties.description: A filter to control what category groups should be traced. A filter can have an optional '-' prefix to exclude category groups that contain a matching category. Having both included and excluded category patterns in the same list is not supported. Examples: `test_MyTest*`, `test_MyTest*,test_OtherStuff`, `-excluded_category1,-excluded_category2`.

properties.name: traceOptions
properties.description: Controls what kind of tracing is enabled, it is a comma-delimited sequence of the following strings: `record-until-full`, `record-continuously`, `trace-to-console`, `enable-sampling`, `enable-systrace`, e.g. `'record-until-full,enable-sampling'`. The first 3 options are trace recording modes and hence mutually exclusive. If more than one trace recording modes appear in the `traceOptions` string, the last one takes precedence. If none of the trace recording modes are specified, recording mode is `record-until-full`. The trace option will first be reset to the default option (`record_mode` set to `record-until-full`, `enable_sampling` and `enable_systrace` set to `false`) before options parsed from `traceOptions` are applied on it.

name: TraceConfig
description: An example TraceConfig that roughly matches what Chrome DevTools records:

properties.name: recording_mode
properties.description: Can be `record-until-full`, `record-continuously`, `record-as-much-as-possible` or `trace-to-console`. Defaults to `record-until-full`.

properties.name: trace_buffer_size_in_kb
properties.description: maximum size of the trace recording buffer in kilobytes. Defaults to 100MB.

properties.name: trace_buffer_size_in_events
properties.description: maximum size of the trace recording buffer in events.

properties.name: enable_argument_filter
properties.description: if true, filter event data according to a specific list of events that have been manually vetted to not include any PII. See the implementation in Chromium for specifics.

properties.name: included_categories
properties.description: a list of tracing categories to include. Can include glob-like patterns using `*` at the end of the category name. See tracing categories for the list of categories.

properties.name: excluded_categories
properties.description: a list of tracing categories to exclude. Can include glob-like patterns using `*` at the end of the category name. See tracing categories for the list of categories.

properties.name: included_process_ids
properties.description: a list of process IDs to include in the trace. If not specified, trace all processes.

properties.name: histogram_names
properties.description: a list of histogram names to report with the trace.

properties.name: memory_dump_config
properties.description: if the `disabled-by-default-memory-infra` category is enabled, this contains optional additional configuration for data collection. See the Chromium memory-infra docs for more information.

properties.name: transactionIdentifier
properties.description: A string that uniquely identifies a successful payment transaction.

properties.name: transactionDate
properties.description: The date the transaction was added to the App Store’s payment queue.

properties.name: originalTransactionIdentifier
properties.description: The identifier of the restored transaction by the App Store.

properties.name: transactionState
properties.description: The transaction state, can be `purchasing`, `purchased`, `failed`, `restored` or `deferred`.

properties.name: errorCode
properties.description: The error code if an error occurred while processing the transaction.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: The error message if an error occurred while processing the transaction.

properties.name: productIdentifier
properties.description: The identifier of the purchased product.

properties.name: quantity
properties.description: The quantity purchased.

properties.name: bytes
properties.description: Content being sent.

properties.name: file
properties.description: Path of file being uploaded.

properties.name: blobUUID
properties.description: UUID of blob data. Use ses.getBlobData method to retrieve the data.

properties.name: type
properties.description: `file`.

properties.name: filePath
properties.description: Path of file to be uploaded.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Defaults to `0`.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Number of bytes to read from `offset`. Defaults to `0`.

properties.name: modificationTime
properties.description: Last Modification time in number of seconds since the UNIX epoch.

properties.name: type
properties.description: `rawData`.

properties.name: bytes
properties.description: Data to be uploaded.

properties.name: startLine
properties.description: Default is 1.
